Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, convenient location, albeit a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: NWKelli
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hyatt at Olive 8 while attending a convention in Seattle. Overall, we found the staff to be very warm and welcoming. A couple of small nitpicks: charging $10/day for wireless access. Hyatt advertises "High-speed wired and wireless Internet access." They should at least let you know up front on their website that there is a charge for that access. The beds were very firm and my husband had a difficult time sleeping while staying there. The bathroom had a glass walk-in shower, so if you have your heart set on a hot bath after walking the hills of Seattle, you will have to make other plans. The valet parking was, we thought, expensive even for Seattle standards. Aside from these things, we enjoyed a quiet and comfortable stay. Next time, we will try to take advantage of Hyatt's Best Rate Guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Olive 8 hyatt stay in march”
Reviews.Author: VanDesigner
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Olive 8 in Seattle. It is in a great location, two block walk to all shops of downtown and easy access to capital hill or Pikes market. You would have to take a taxi to belltown restaurants or walk 15 min. The rooms are nice and spacious. Our only issue this time around was the very loud chatting staff that woke us up at 8 on a Sunday morning. It may not be early for some but when on vacation I like to have my rest and not worry about alarms, especially on a Sunday. The hotel is also renovating the lobby and there is lots of jackhammering, it wasnt heard in the rooms but made for a less than grand experience as you enter/exit hotel. Overall I recommend this hotel! It feels good to support a LEED certified building and their sustainable philosophy. Tip: the hairdryers are provided but do not Offer much heat and will take a long Time to actually dry your hair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: MMJJ
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Olive 8 was perfect for a couple of nights in Seattle on our way to Vancouver. Centrally located, modern, clean and helpful. We had a king room connecting to a double for our kids 16 and 12. Plenty of space. Our first time in Seattle. Loved lunch at The Space Needle. Weather was great. We got lucky. Seattle is beautiful. Two days was plenty of time to explore the city. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business and was fortunate to have been upgraded to a 1br suite. Room was great. Very quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nomorebake
Reviews.Content: Went here for a conference and it had everything one could need. Great location, friendly and competent staff, nice rooms and a nice place to hold a conference. I had only one glitch when my room key suddenly wouldn't work, and still didn't work after I took it to the front desk to get them to fix it. I had to go back to my conference and fret about it until we were done. No fretting was needed since after the conference I called the desk from the phone by the elevators on my room's floor, and within 5 minutes someone was there with new keys that worked. All in all a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: yippie22
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a place to review the spa, but I guess it's just part of the hotel. I stayed across the street at the Grand Hyatt and had a couples massage at the spa in Olive 8. It was amazing! You get a locker and can take a shower with the most awesome shampoo and conditioner I've ever used (it's not on the market yet, I asked). Then you can take a swim in the pool or sit in the hot tub so remember to bring your swim suite. The chairs in the lounging room was relaxing as was the cucumber water. The massage was absolutely perfect and relaxing. I wish I could remember my person's name because she deserves a public compliment. The prices are high, but definitely worth it. I did also eat in the restaurant downstairs. The staff was very friendly. I'm pretty sure my eggs were a little undercooked, but the food was still good. The place has a modern feel, very bright, boxy and modern. It was good for breakfast. I am not sure what they had at night.

Reviews.Title: “The location downtown Seattle was perfect, the hotel clean and management amazing!”
Reviews.Author: georgia-ann
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located, it was clean, well stocked, and the management was amazing! (Our safe wasn't working) The bed was super comfy. I got a great deal through Priceline.com

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome stay at The Hyatt at Olive 8!”
Reviews.Author: hlh4shots
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, and again, 5 star all the way! From the moment we walk in we feel less stress, and right at home. The staff is always top notch. Food and drinks at Urbane deelish! Rooms are spacious, totally cool, and quiet. This second time we won an auction stay and was a little concerned we might be put in a smaller room, but nope! Just as nice as the first time! Our late night bartender, (Danielle maybe?) was super nice and an excellent bartender. We will be back for sure! Hoping for another "staycation" and do the spa next time! Thanks so much for being so great!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL & SPA!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This is a truly GREAT HOTEL with wonderfull staff members, a fantastic restaurant and the BEST spa in town!!! Thank you Olive 8…

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown, no car needed”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel. Very easy to get to from the Sea-tac airport. Took the light rail ($2.75) from airport to the West lake station (last stop) and walked with luggage the short 1/4 mile (easy walk) to the hotel. Very nice staff (we had a group of six that had a bottle of wine one in our group brought with while in the lobby visiting and they brought us 6 glasses so we could toast our trip). Service was outstanding! Rooms are very nice, quiet, eco smart design (you will see what I mean if you stay here). Great restaurants in the area and shopping (don't miss Nordstrums Rack down the street). Great bed, open shower but no tub which I guess is the norm here in Seattle. Guess that is why it is sleepless in Seattle if you like a bath to relax you. 4.95 out of five stars. Great for conferences as well!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel - not the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JohninCanada
Reviews.Content: Great room - super large - great views, super clean - great service. great location. We only spent one night on way home to Victoria - arrived with 2 young kids - this is more of a business hotel but everyone was super kind and accomodating to the kids. the pool was also nice and warm - very important with young kids. so no complaints - except restuarant downstairs where it took 45 minutes for food to arrive and it was not good - strawberries for kids were rotten, food mediocre, bread rock hard - and need less to say in a hotel not cheap. so to make a long story short - great hotel - eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but otherwise awesome.”
Reviews.Author: cassterson
Reviews.Content: I loved the Olive 8, especially since they were so environmentally friendly BUT you could hear everything. Noises from the hallway and your neighbors. We were around the corner from the elevator but we could still hear it ding when it opened it's doors. Luckily the guests are pretty quiet. The pool deck is heated and it's nice. They gave us free red wine and chocolates when we checked in since it was my boyfriend's birthday. The wine wasn't very good but the chocolate cherries were great. We had to ask for the wine/chocolates three times before it actually made it to our room though. Checking in at this hotel was way better than any other hotel I've ever been too. The staff was incredible friendly. Great hotel price too. The bathrooms didn't have enough towel (etc) hanging hooks. The location isn't bad either unless if you want to hang out in Capital Hill, which I highly recommend the Hip on the Hill tour and ask for Nick, or want to shop downtown. Quick cab ride to Space Needle and Pike's or a longer walk to Pike's.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: magnusgi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in March 2012. Hotel perfectly located in the centre of Seattle, close to everything. Very friendly staff. Nice room. Could be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KKat_NYC
Reviews.Content: Highlghts include LEED certified hotel, fabulous salt water pool ang gym, fantastic spa, best coffee in the lobby and beatiful modern hotel. I ate at Urbane wqhich was wonderful but expensive. I had a corner king room, big windows. The only bad thing was the low low water pressure in the room - took forever to shower. I'm not sure if this was the super saver shower head or being on the 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: edtani
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the last week. The room is excellent, spacious, modern, very clean. They also have a big pool for swimming, Jacuzzi, both with salt water. a humid and dry sauna. a very modern gym. very friendly staff. in a few words this hotel has great facilities for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: djjbtoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel March 5-9, 2012 on business - I was attending a conference at the convention centre which was less than a 5 min walk away. The location was very good. The fridge in the room was handy. The service was great, the rooms modern, large and kept clean, the gym was well equipped but often the water cooler was empty. The wireless internet could have been a bit faster. The walls are thin and you can hear loud talking in adjacent rooms. The water pressure was so weak it took forever to shower (and get soap off your skin). I understand water conservation but I would normally take 5 min to shower, not 20. I think you end up using more water with these systems in the end. These were really the only main annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Seattle”
Reviews.Author: KeroroGunso
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a suite. Fantastic room with great views. Large bath with deep tub and separate shower. Really liked the 24hr fitness room. Pool was nice and usually empty. Right off Pike so tons of options for food and shopping. Good internet speeds. Quick walk to the Market. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but same as the rest”
Reviews.Author: acculligan
Reviews.Content: I have to say walking in to this hotel is quite nice. The music playing in the lobby is cool, calm and serene. The rooms are good, but not spectacular. The bathrooms do steal the show - although they don't have a bathtub - at least in the king deluxe it doesn't. The space is ample, but I overlooked a roof top so be sure to ask for a higher floor than say 7. The gym is well equipped and the pool actually has the capability of doing laps which is rare. All in all a good hotel, but i wouldn't' switch loyalty programs to stay at this Hyatt. It's a good hotel...with no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “wish i could live here”
Reviews.Author: itravelSeattle
Reviews.Content: I love the modern styling of these rooms! The views are great the location is great and the pool has speakers under the water so you can hear it while you swim!!! The room service was quick and the portions were huge!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect from a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: embargo
Reviews.Content: Don't be confused with the Hyatt just up the street, there is a reason the name is called Hyatt At Olive 8. As you can tell from my opening line, we got a bit confused about which Hyatt to stay at. In any case, the two hotels are just a short walk from each other. Having stayed at both Hyatt's I would prefer the Hyatt At Olive 8. It is a much smaller hotel, from its welcoming lobby to its laid back feel when you arrive at the Hotel. The rooms a reasonable size and I certainly appreciated the efforts made to go green. When you enter the room you are required to place your key card into a holder near the door; this is responsible for activating the lights throughout the room--a really nice feature but it takes a bit to get use to not using the light switches. In all, the hotel is very clean and room service food is actually edible. I suggest taking a visit to the gym and saline pool. You will enjoy your trip here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Amazing Nights!”
Reviews.Author: Enels70
Reviews.Content: I Booked this Night For My Boyfriend and I For Valentines Day. Every little Detail Was amazing. The Corner King Suite with the Sweeping Views of The City, The Chic Modern Decor, and the HUGE Spacious Room made the Night Perfect. The over size bathroom with the stone shower was Amazing. Even the Comp Champagne with Strawberries. The Staff Was amazing From the Valet to the Maids. It seemed as my every Wish was THEIR Command. They were even Nice enough to switch our comp next day breakfast (which was only good for the hotel restaurant) to in room dinning. My Only wish was that we couldn't stay longer than one night. We will Defiantly be staying Again. Thank you Again for making this an Amazing Valentines Day for us!

Reviews.Title: “Eco-Chic & Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: ArrivalsTravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the luxurious and centrally-located Hyatt at Olive 8. As the first LEED certified hotel in Seattle, Olive 8 offers chic, modern rooms with iPod docking stations, an indoor-pool and eco-friendly spa and restaurant. We highly recommend this property! arrivalstravel.com

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with the best gym and spa in town!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDC
Reviews.Content: I come to Seattle often and have stayed at various hotels. This was my 4th or 5th stay at Hyatt Olive 8. It's not your typical large Hyatt, but rather more like a boutique hotel. The rooms are really nice. Large showers, comfotable beds and very eco friendly. The gym and spa are two of the highlights there. The location is great and the staff are excellent, friendly and helpful. This is now my only choice for Seattle. Urbane restaurant in the lobby is excellent, and if you are a seafood lover, especially raw bar, the Blueacre restaurant one block away is the place to go for $1 oysters happy hour every day!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: kate02121
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly impressed with my stay here. The fitness center was huge and seemed brand new. My room was spacious and luxurious, and came with a robe. The staff was friendly, and the concierge fantastic. The restaurant was delicious. Two minor complaints: the spa is really expensive, and there is no gift shop or easy way to get a quick snack or bottle of water (they might have built one since my stay).

Reviews.Title: “Nice to stay”
Reviews.Author: sabai77Pijnacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last year and we had a suite. Very spacious and close to the centre of Seattle. The only thing we didn´t like was the breakfast. This restaurant wasn´t Hyatt owned. Very poor breakfast and also the staff wasn´t perfect in their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel feel with fantastic pool and gym”
Reviews.Author: Travis J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the past 2 years both alone and with my family. The staff are friendly and accomodating and make everyone feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BrandyLew19
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, beautifully decorated, friendly staff and all! Visited Seattle for a Conference and this hotel is a short two block walk to the convention center. We used the Downtown Shuttle Service to and from the airport and was very pleased with them as well. I enjoyed my stay at the Olive 8!! Hotel was EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good location, green!”
Reviews.Author: reclaimyourlifeagain
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference for work. This hotel was a short block from the convention center, and also a easy to get to from the airport (took the light rail - got off at Westlake and walked a couple blocks). We could also walk to Pike Market, which we did when we found a break from the ever-present rain. We also walked to the monorail and went to the Space Needle. Easy! They charge for the internet, but I signed up for their "gold passport" rewards program, so I got the internet for free and also got a free late-checkout. I'd recommend doing this! The hotel is more than what I usually pay for hotels because I am *cheap*, but work paid for it, so I enjoyed the luxury. The room was nice, very clean, and the overall vibe of this place was sleek and modern. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants, because I'm cheap and vegan- this place looked fancy and more expensive then what I'm used to. I liked the green features, and was happy to support a LEED building. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this place if work is paying for it, or if you are used to staying in nicer places (and paying for it), or if you have more money than me. :) It was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - modern, contemporary, yet comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NuadaSilverHand
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a corner room. They upgraded from 4th to 11th floor - so the views, while not spectacular - an "interior" view of the city and the Paramount Theater - were nice. Big windows on both sides. Very comfortable king bed and nice sheets and duvet. Comfortable chairs. Big LCD TV if that is your thing. Interior design of the room and entire hotel is modern, chic, yet comfortable. Excellent fitness room - lots of machines and room, all in good order. The saunas and steam rooms are clean - though without being a spa "guest" you are relegated to using one of the lockers out by the pool - so keep that in mind when dressing (or not). The spa is excellent according to my wife. The bathroom was spacious, clean, modern with lots stone and tile, shower water good and strong and hot. The hotel restaurant - Urbane - offers nice breakfast options - lots of well-made sweet and savoury dishes. The hotel is close to Belltown, Pike Place, and downtown for shopping, restaurants, and sight seeing. I would gladly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: R0sy20
Reviews.Content: Loved my 5-night stay here - attentive and genuinely friendly service from everyone; nice room. Only a few small complaints: wish the cafe in the lobby was open past 11 am; and very slight wear and tear in my room (a surprise, since the place is so new - slight discoloration in the shower; chipped edge on nightstand). I tried the spa there as well, which was fantastic and I got a superb massage from Sarah. They do add an automatic 20% gratuity to spa services, which I think is a little presumptuous, but you can adjust it if you wish. Generally excellent. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Sensitive Service!”
Reviews.Author: sfexile
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for the MLA Conference and was horrified to find that I had been given a room with no bathtub. As an older woman relaxing in a warm bath is an important stress reliever for me and a normal part of my day. When I was young a room with just a shower was called a half bath, and you only found them in the cheapest motels. But I now have come to understand that modern people don't take baths, only showers, so this new hotel was built without many tubs. I tried to be a good sport, but felt unhappy. Laurie at the front desk picked up on this and decided to upgrade me to a suite (with a spa bath). It could not have been more lovely. In addition to a generally sensitive and helpful staff this hotel has everything anyone could want. It's very clean, quiet, and beautifully appointed. The beds are comfortable, the artwork attractive. The restaurant is also very good. I do plan to return and when I do I'll make sure when I book that my room has a tub.

Reviews.Title: “Time to give up on Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: greek75
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th stay at a Hyatt and again a Very expensive mistake. I gave into the let's try it once again. It started with reservations, the agent could have cared less and every "holiday special ' was NOT available at that particular Hyatt. I asked about Gold membership which imo is useless, it has taken many p/c to prove our former stays to no avail, thus we do not get the next tier. We stayed in a King Deluxe , I did my reserach, of course photos APPEAR great, but the room was worn out and dirty ( maybe b/c it is a "green" hotel. We also left with a parting gift: stomach flu ugh ! I am so tired of paying $$$ for a hotel that does not deliver what is promises. Next time : 4 Seasons. Housekeeping was spot on but there is only so much you can do with GREEN cleaning products. Other issues: taking a shower is an ordeal, no hot water, no pressure. and just a shower. Carpet threadbare, linen not as clean as I would expect. The pool was cold and the hot tub could hardly be called HOT, come on Hyatt this is Seattle, rainy and cold winters! BTW, I did kindly take my concerns to the staff but "there is nothing we can do" was the common response. The spa offers little and overpriced, I ended up going to the Spa at Nordstom , Great ! Hyatt may look modern, you may be a member of the membership tiers, but do not expect any , extras, upgrades, ( what is the point of being a loyal patron/member ? ) do not expect any assistance from management - and Check your BILL before paying , I have given up on Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room on a higher floor away from the street”
Reviews.Author: cdrennan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and really modern. I had a very nice room, great looking bathroom/design. I only stayed one night but it was great. A bonus (this might be normal for Hyatt's) but they gave a travel size toothpaste from a name brand. Bonus for me since I forgot mine. Its located in the downtown area. Unfortunately this means you have to pay for parking... I had a room on the 4th floor and unfortunately across from the elevators. Obviously I prefer to not be near the elevators but I checked in late. The bad thing about being on a lower floor was the street noise such as buses etc. It wasn't horrible, but I am a light sleeper and it probably started around 530am. My coworker had a HUGE room on the 14th floor since she is a Hyatt diamond status. Her room was CRAZY nice. She had a room that was bigger than my 2 bedroom townhouse. I am pretty sure it was 800 sq ft. Had a completely TV sitting area that you can close a door to the bedroom/bathroom, 2 closets, and in the bathroom, a huge tub (I am 5'8" and had plenty of room to spare) and in one of the mirrors they had a tv. hilarious and awesome. I booked a room with AAA and had a good rate of ~150 which included breakfast in their restaurant Urbane. For that low rate, I had a delicious Crab Benedict. Tasty tasty tasty. I would easily stay here again, hopefully staying in a higher floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon G
Reviews.Content: We love this place, and wouldn't hesitate to come back here again. The staff were incredibly friendly, geniune and helpful, and the location was within easy walking distance of many key attractions. Decor was nice, food was good, and the room very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelBH
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the pier The staff is very helpful. The rooms were very clean. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paper. Thin. Walls.”
Reviews.Author: pickytexan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pretty, modern, clean and the rooms are enormous. It's everything you'd expect from this type of hotel. HOWEVER, the walls are paper thin. It's 6am and I've already overheard an entire phone conversation, conducted in a normal conversational volume by one neighbor and I can hear the tv show my other neighbor has been watching because he probably can't sleep because he hears me typing. The restaurant URBANE is pretty good. The food is tasty, especially the seafood, but the service is terrible. I am here for work and have a feeling I'm going to be sleeping very, very poorly due to the very thin walls. Also, NO TUBS. Why Hyatt?

Reviews.Title: “Eco-Friendly, Super-Chic”
Reviews.Author: HGreenSpeaks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times recently for work. It is a really nice hotel, and is perfectly situated near the theaters (Paramount and 5th ave), and all of the downtown shopping. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The lobby is spacious, and valet parking is easy, although a bit spendy ($30/night) but that seems to be the rate in Seattle. They have a nice on-site restaurant/bar, Urbane, attached to the lobby. Only downsides of the lobby is that there is really not a business center, and to print 5 pages is free, after that it is 25 cents per page. Also, their on-site ATM charges $4 per transaction, but there are other cheaper ATM's nearby. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. All of the linens are fresh and of good quality. The bathrooms are really nice and come with extra amenities like toothpaste etc. on top of the normal soap, conditioner etc. Only drawback of the room is that the shower is really nice, but a bit sparse on the water as it has a water-saving head. Overall, a really nice hotel especially in the winter when you are not as likely to want to be too close to the water front.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: With spacious, modern rooms and a host of amenities, this hotel does a lot of things right. The rooms at this property are generously sized and were spotless, with a large LCD TV and a spacious bathroom with a stand-up shower and a one-sink vanity. Note that there are no tubs in the standard rooms, which may make bathing difficult if you are travelling with young children. The rooms also offer an expansive work area, with complimentary WiFi. The hotel has a full suite of amenities, with a large, modern and well-equipped gym and a clean, attractive pool area to fully equipped locker rooms and a pretty good restaurant with reasonably priced happy hour options. The hotel should be commended for not charging guests extra to access the locker room areas with steam and sauna. Service was friendly and efficient. Though the hotel is not as centrally located as some properties (it's a 10 to 15 minute walk to the market, for example), all of the other advantages outweigh that fact.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: scottyinphx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September 2011 (a little late getting to the reviewing!) for a conference. The rooms were very nice and I had a spectacular view of Seattle from my room. I was there for a conference, so I appreciated the hotel's proximity to all the conference goings-on. I ate at the restaurant one day for breakfast and it was nice -- nothing spectacular, in my opinion. For the conference rate ($179/night) it was a good choice, but if I had to pay any more than that, I'm not sure I'd stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: norwegiangirl70
Reviews.Content: We spent a family weekend at this hotel and it was very enjoyable. Friendly and helpful staff - very clean, comfortable beds, wonderful saltwater swimming pool and jacuzzi. Did not try the spa, but the dressing rooms adjacent to the pool had steam room and sauna and such nice amenities that you felt like you were in a spa anyway! The food in the restaurant was good, generous portions. The kids loved the items on the kids menu. Very convenient location to shopping, the Space Needle/Seattle Center area. Walking distance to all downtown attractions. Definetely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: OlympicPeninsula2
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive to stay on the "edge" of downtown Seattle, but not anymore! The Hyatt at Olive 8 was a delightful experience. From the greeting and escort to the front desk, to the "green" features, I was truly impressed. I booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a great deal! The night lighting, dining room, and extra features in the bedroom made this a perfect overnight in the city. I will definitely stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great gym, nice cafe...”
Reviews.Author: beardiegal
Reviews.Content: Just enough off the central district to be quiet, but close enough that everything (Pike Market, shopping district, museums, library) is in walking distance... Also very close to the public transit hub, so perfect location for getting to the outer districts... A very nice alternative to the mega hotels, intimate, nice cafe, and absolutely the best gym/fitness center in town.... Safe, quiet, comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, EXPENSIVE PARKING!”
Reviews.Author: jordan604
Reviews.Content: Came down for Monday night football. Stayed 2 nights. Rooms were nice and modern. Desserts need improvement at the hotel restaurants. Swimming pool was great!!! PARKING PARKING PARKING WAS A RIP OFF!!!! This hotel would have been a 5/5 if it had cheaper parking. And for the price we payed please tell your valet drivers to stop socializing while a line up of cars are trying to park!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and spacious”
Reviews.Author: John1970031
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good location downtown, only a few steps away from the airport train, a nice walk to the harbour and the convention center. The check-in was swift and friendly, the room was nice, spacious and specklessly clean. A nice bathroom and amenities make this a perfect hotel. Never had breakfeast there but the bar and the restaurant are quite nice (though not very cosy).

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised !”
Reviews.Author: Ghostrider5408
Reviews.Content: As a hyatt Diamond I was not sure of this hotel when i made the reservations but I have to say that it gives it's sister property a real run for it's money or I should say MY money! While all of my stays in Seattle are business this property would be my choice for a personal stay as well. I have now listed this as my favorite in Seattle to book. Great Staff, very very nice rooms and the restaurant is very nice. Bar area is small and uninviting they could do something there for us road warriors never the less nice.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK!”
Reviews.Author: Chaidetepoz
Reviews.Content: It had the feel of a chain hotel, somewhat disconnected from the guest... I booked a standard King online, and was super disappointed that there was no bathtub in the room! Please don't tell me that a shower is more eco-friendly because I won't buy it. Also, I did not like that the lighting in the entire room was controlled ONLY by the card key placed into the slot near the door. At first I did not think it would be a problem, but there was no way to control the lighting from the bed/bathroom area without the key being in, so that was annoying. Another thing - I did not think the valet parking should have been quite as expensive as it was at 30 something dollars a night - especially considering there were no other options! I know that big city hotels charge these kind of prices, but there are usually alternatives and there wasn't this time. The room was clean - nothing special though. For being one of the only LEED certified buildings in Washington State, it did not have a different ambiance or feeling about it... If it is an eco friendly hotel then why still have the little plastic bottles of shampoo and conditioner? Why not install a unit in the shower like the Hotel Nexus (also in Seattle) has? My room had a couple of small burn holes (maybe from a cigarette?) on the rug near the window. The last thing that I want to comment on was the spa... Nothing about it stands out to me as being awesome, and nothing about it seemed any more eco-friendly than any other spa, I am sorry to say! In fact, I really disliked the fact that once I was changed into my robe I had to walk into an open area (not in the spa itself, where anyone could be walking by to go to the gym, etc.) by the reception desk on the way into and out of the spa. When I have nothing but a robe on the last thing I want to do is worry about anybody, even the reception desk workers seeing me - I just want some privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MOJOCOFFEE
Reviews.Content: Over the recent American Thanksgiving weekend, we stayed at Hyatt @ Olive 8 with another couple and enjoyed our experience very much. This hotel is fairly new (3 years old) and its design is very modern and simple. In fact, it is one of the only LEED certified buildings in Washington State (pretty cool). The staff were very helpful and accommodating to our needs (referred to us by our names after only 30 minutes of being on the property). The location is one of the best in Seattle (close to almost everything). The rooms are cozy, spacious and comfortable. We have stayed many times in the Downtown area of Seattle over the last 15 years and the Hyatt @ Olive 8 is definitely in our top 3 ever. We will look forward to staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianaA
Reviews.Content: What a great experience we had at the Hyatt at Olive 8. Everything was perfect, staff were professional, helpful and friendly. We were a group of four friends (2 mothers with grown up daughters) and went to Seattle for a weekend shopping trip to celebrate our birthdays. The girls used the gym and pool and enjoyed them. We were given complimentary wine and chocolates in our room, such a lovely gesture. Our rooms (we had 3) were clean spacious and comfortable. The Hyatt at Olive 8 is our new favourite hotel in Seattle and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RNandfamily
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and the rooms very clean. The pool area is fantastic. Loved the look of the sliding doors in the rooms, but they tended to let too much noise and light into the bedroom area. The hotel is within walking distance of many sites or it is close to mass transit.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: CitizenDave
Reviews.Content: Why do places like this insist on charging for wifi? Wifi should be like water and electricity. Always on.

Reviews.Title: “slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: cgstine33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night away from our baby girl. It was awesome. It is a great location in downtown Seattle, within walking distance to downtown, Cap Hill and S Lake Union. Lots of great places to eat within walking distance and our favorite coffee shop on the corner - Caffe Ladro! The room was nice, small and tidy. The linens were very good and the bed was comfy. The service was friendly and kind. The only thing we thought was strange was that certain things seemed a little dirty (hallway carpet all stained as you get out of the elevator) and room furniture quite scratched up. This was weird since this is a relatively new and higher end hotel. At the end of the day, these things didn't really bother us too much because everything else was so great. Note to management though, carpets shouldn't be junky in a 4star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay; nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay77Cee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on vacation in late-August. Generally a good stay but a few issues. Good location and an easy walk to lots of transport, shopping and eating options. Despite travelling solo the area seemed safe and fine to me. Staff very friendly, especially housekeeping and restaurant / bar staff. On arrival I was a bit disappointed with the low room and told corner suites were only on lower floors - seemed odd. But otherwise staff great and helpful. Room was comfortable and well appointed. Everything felt new and clean. Spacious room and comfortable bed / furniture. However, room was a bit dark and opening / closing curtains was awkward given placement behind desk. Bathroom was large and clean. Shower OK but non-existent water pressure and constantly cold. This was the major flaw. Good TV, IPOD player and in-room fridge (for personal items only) all good. Great restaurant and bar - good food, cocktails and drinks and a nice atmosphere. All up a good stay, though with some flaws that would make me think twice before staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuckers
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple nights at the Hyatt at Olive 8 in Seattle while looking at some colleges. I found out later that its not the best area, but we never felt unsafe. In fact, we walked around qauite a bit. There was a lot of shopping and food choices within a short walk. I thought the rooms were very pretty. They beds were comfy, and the sheets felt crisp and clean. The bathroom was pretty standard, but clean and all the amenities we needed. Staff was helpful and friendly. We asked for more towels and they were brought to us within 10 minutes of asking. The pool area was nice, we didnt go in, but walked by and people seemed to be enjoying it. There seemed to be plenty of chairs by the pool, too. We liekd the gym. Felt up-to-date. it was clean, and cool inside. I dont have anything negative to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as nice as Grand Hyatt, but plenty nice”
Reviews.Author: gbn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011. For an extra $20/night we got an over-sized queen, which had a lot of extra space, but nothing useful in it (i.e., a huge entryway, but no furniture or a closet or anything else to do with it; a standard sized bathroom; a lot of empty space by the corner). Everything is nice and new. This is just two doors over from the Grand Hyatt (the Paramount Hotel is in between), two blocks from the Seattle Convention Center. Very nice 24h fitness center. A sort of mini-Starbucks for morning coffee & snacks. My only complaints: first, the LEED certification evidently left the hotel wanting to only include low-wattage lighting, and only desk or floor fixtures (no overhead lighting in the rooms). Overall, there was just not enough light in the room. Brighter (CFL) bulbs would help, so would some overhead lighting. My other complaint, which applies overall to Hyatt: please, get some better toiletries. In the world of business travel and TSA grope-fests, I try to travel without bringing my own shampoo etc. The Hyatt Portico brand is consistent with 2.5 star hotels, and they should do better. Enough whining for one review. This really is a very nice hotel, with some nice touches for their LEED certification. It's not as fancy as the Grand Hyatt, but a tad cheaper to make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to a friend!”
Reviews.Author: damartinez
Reviews.Content: Location -- Well situated on what I would call the "edge" of downtown but also within walking distance to Pike Street, Nortdrom, etc. We never used our car after giving it to the valet -- we were able to walk everywhere. Facility -- Rooms were very clean and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable. The "green" aspect of the hotel was fun -- we enjoyed having to use our room key to power our lights. Many reviews state that the walls are thin and they are CORRECT -- we could hear converstations in the room next door, as well as housekeeping staff in the hall. Price -- We were able to Priceline our room for only $135 per night which, for a 4 star hotel in downtown Seattle, is an outstanding deal. Parking was expensive (about $41 valet for 24 hours) but not necessarily out of touch with rates around the city. I did not notice an option for self parking at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hshtraveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel - bedrooms were very nice and modern. Nice sized bathroom that was very modern. Loved the fitness center - top notch with state of the art equipment. Location of hotel was also very good. Right next to all the shopping and just a short walk to Pike's Market and the Spaceneedle. Central location in downtown Seattle allowed us to basically walk everywhere. My only complaint - no free services were offered. Internet was $9.95 for 24 hours and there was no business center with a computer. Nowadays there are so many nice hotels that offer free internet and free breakfast so it's kind of disappointing when you spend a lot to stay at a nice hotel and then you have to pay for those extras on top of the room charge. I know that's how it usually works in big cities though when you stay downtown. I was very surprised that there was no business center with a computer that you could have at least paid to use. I know we live in a society filled with laptops, ipads, etc., but for the leisure traveler who doesn't travel with those items, a business center is handy. The hotel staff was VERY friendly!!! Everytime we came and went, we were greeted by the front desk staff. Overall, we had a great time at this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this fairly new property. Its an ultra modern and comfortable hotel in downtown Seattle. Its slightly off to the side of the main area where the other cluster of downtown hotels are but an excellent area and walking distance from the Airport light rail station if you want to go green to this eco friendly hotel. The room was very comfortable, modern and well lit. Great bedding and bathroom amenities. The gym is excellent, and you can use the spa including separate mens and womens steam, sauna and showers. Its a great set up. The hotel is very near Pacific place which is great for food and shopping. There are lots of great restaurants in the area if you want to dine elsewhere. Cafe Ladro is nearby if you want some good seattle local brew. I didnt use the hotel restaurant but found the service to be very good on concierge requests and valet services. I enjoyed my stay very much, and would definitely return when I go back to the emerald city.

Reviews.Title: “modern, fun, and close to all in downtown”
Reviews.Author: garymiller
Reviews.Content: we love the indoor 2nd floor deluxe pool, great Urbane restaurant and it's fabulous happy hours, 7 days a week, and comfy rooms, only issue is their internet, slow and often doesn't work well.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: spokan
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. One and a half blocks to Metro Transit Free Zone, bus or underground and five blocks to Seatac Airport light rail or to the Monorail to Seattle center. Don't bother to bring your car, parking is expensive downtown. Hotel front desk staff are all excellent and room is comfortable. Queen bed was very good, bathroom large, well stocked and bright. Coffee drinkers complaint, one paper cup coffee maker but they did keep me supplied with enough filter packs when I asked.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Best stay in years.”
Reviews.Author: Beegee91
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. The room was lovely, large and well appointed. The staff was outstanding, the location perfect, and the pool & spa were a great way to relax at the end of the day. This was the best hotel stay I've had in years!

Reviews.Title: “I have never written a hotel review before, but Hyatt at olive 8 is amazing I just had to!”
Reviews.Author: Rhpape
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt at olive 8 back in late July 2011. We were supposed to stay two nights leading up to our Alaskan cruise honeymoon. Delta screwed up our whole flight arrangement (never had a good experience with Delta) and we ended up running from gate to gate at our transfers and arriving in Seattle after midnight. Since we did not call to tell them we were going to make it they cancelled our room for the night. HOWEVER, when I called they were already on it. They put my wife and I up at the Hyatt regency around the corner in a big suite at no charge! They asked us to come back to Hyatt at olive 8 the next day with an upgrade over the standard king room we reserved. When we showed up they put us in one of their largest suites at no extra charge! Also, they left us a bottle of champagne on ice, some chocolates, and vouchers for free room service breakfast the next morning (it was delicious)! We were floored. Everything was fantastic. The room was the largest suite we had ever been in, and it was beautiful. Very modern and hi tech! Every person we dealt with at the hotel seemed to know who we were and all about our earlier cancellation. They were all so friendly. To top it off, being the cheap guy I am I noticed they charged me at the non AAA rate I reserved. Being the cheap guy I am I brought it up and hey knocked off an extra 100 bucks instead of the 25 I was expecting. I have never experienced such fantastic service at a hotel! I'm not sure if the hotel reads these reviews, but if they do I'm so sorry for taking so long to write this up. You guys helped our honeymoon be an extremely memorable experience. Thank you so much! We want to travel back to Seattle just to stay at this hotel! (won't be traveling on delta)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbiefan5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Olive 8 for just one night but enjoyed every minute we were there! Beautiful hotel, amazing service, and great location!!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb and the poooool :-)!”
Reviews.Author: judith14
Reviews.Content: The hyatt is a reliable and good hotel from which you can easily wander through the lovely city of Seattle :-)!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and outstanding location!”
Reviews.Author: Abazaba
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in a Hyatt for awhile and wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. From Seatac, we took the new Seattle light rail. It was about a 40 minute right from the airport - only $2.75 to downtown. From there, there is about a 3.5 block walk to the hotel. No problem if you're traveling light. We were on the 15th floor near the corner - I think 1565. Nice room, decent view, fairly quiet, although I would have expected it to be a bit more noise-proof (water running from the next room) given the Hyatt name. Everything was in excellent working order - plumbing, lights, doors, switches, etc. They have energy saving lights and it's a bit annoying to have to insert your room key in the wall switch each time you enter. But hey, I like doing my part to be more green. Service was first rate. Everyone was super friendly. I sure wish they they had in-room wifi w/o a charge. Being the cheapskate I am, I walked down to the lobby each day to use the free wifi available there. All in all it was a very good experience and I would definitely stay there again. The location was primo - near the Westlake Station (monorail & light rail stops) and walking distance to Pike Street Market. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “The joys of swimming!”
Reviews.Author: teezee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully located and the spa is grand. Swimming pool, sauna and steam room are a great way to recover from walking the hills of Seattle. The bed is excellent: firm and soft with good pillows. The room is equipped with everything you need and the bathroom provisions in both the room and the spa are first-rate. The desk is friendly, the coffee bar in the lobby is comfortable and, while we didn't try the restaurant, you are so well-located that it is easy to find intriguing options right near by. Prices were remarkably reasonable for the amenities provided. Good job, Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky digs, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter_dc
Reviews.Content: My hubby was staying here for a conference. It is close to everything in downtown Seattle. Pike's Place is an easy 10-minute walk, and the light rail is about two blocks away. Our room on the 10th floor was small but comfortable with views of downtown. The bed is soft, with plenty of fluffy pillows. A robe comes with the room. I didn't care for the bathroom amenities, considering they are an LEED building I expected Aveda or better. The blow-dryer is OK, it is one of those that has a collapsible handle, but at least not one of those wall units. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel_16
Reviews.Content: It pays to stay in a new hotel. Modern, new furniture. Clean room. Had a very comfortable stay. We liked this place a lot, though wish Internet access in our room hadn't cost extra. it is 2011, after all. The room did strangely echo, though, especially the bathroom. They used lovely tiles in the bathroom, along with a glass pocket door (which is quite loud to open and close in the middle of the night) and I think that's why the bathroom is quite loud. And all sounds associated with, um, bathroom use tend to carry. But a very nice place in a good location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rickoutdoors
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in August 2011. The rooms were nicely furnished- although one of the bathrooms had an opaque glass door rather than a solid closing wood door. The rooms were quiet, and I liked the conservation on/off feature to the lights. The breakfast restaurant on the first floor had good food, but the speed of service was slow (this on the one day when we needed to be in a hurry). The concierge was really helpful in assisting us in navigating around the traffic on a busy weekend. We really liked the location- easy to get to most of the major downtown landmarks- and near at least 6 coffee shops, major bookstores, and several department stores. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: riesenweber3131
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a quick trip to Seattle and really enjoyed it. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and nicely furnished with a modern design, and the lobby bar was perfect for cocktails and appetizers. We usually stay at the W hotel, but were glad we chose the Hyatt for a nice change of pace. Definitely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Impression”
Reviews.Author: LUVSASKATCHEWAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after making a mistake in coordinating our flight and hotel booking. Excellent concierge service, we asked about a restaurant to eat at. The concierge inquired about what kind of food and then proceeded to call the restaurant and make a reservation. I can tell you this did not happen at the Grand Hyatt across the street where the remainder of our stay was. Room was very nice but the walls were a little thin.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place!”
Reviews.Author: iluvryno
Reviews.Content: Great looking hotel, in and out. Staff was very friendly and rooms were fantasti c! Bathrooms were big and had everything you needed - even toothpaste. Furniture was comfy and bed was super for sleeping. Had a poor view off the 4th floor - a grassy roof - but whatever. Location is perfect whether you're going to Convention Center or walking to shop/dine/hit Pike's Place. They even have a running map that takes you down to the waterfront with mile markers on the map. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 'Little Hyatt' !!”
Reviews.Author: PatandDiSpokane
Reviews.Content: If you don't want the glamorous trappings of the BIG Hyatt Hotel lobby, etc.. this Hyatt at Olive 8 is just as glamorous when you get to the inside workings of this darling hotel. Rooms are beautifully furnished, large with all the amenities offered by it's Big Sister around the corner. Located two blocks from the main shopping area of Seattle and a short 6 blocks to the center of Pike Street Market. Across the street from the Paramount Theater and two blocks from the main entrance to the Convention Center. Coffee bar off the lobby offered excellent pastries in the morning. A small outside cafe was busy the entire day. (With the weather being outstanding the three days we were in the city.) Front desk staff was exceptionally gracious, bell staff was outstanding as well as the valet parking staff. Everyone we came into contact with made us feel like we were the only guests in the hotel... it was totally booked the entire time we stayed. We consider this a jewel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Williams1949
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we were able to check into our room early, great location, an easy walk down to Pike Market, fabulous shopping close by, staff were great. Will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location. Breakfast - not so good”
Reviews.Author: Steve541
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on the 14th floor of the hotel. Wonderful room. Bar area, lounge area, separate wc, bathroom was fantastic. Tv in the mirror and rain shower were a nice touch. Tv in the lounge and another in the bedroom. Very clean. My only down side would be that breakfast was not complimentary, at this price I would expect it. We ended up eating in the hotel restuarant for breakfast in any case, it was really nothing special - potatoes were super salty and we had to ask three times to aquire all the necessary cutlery and condiments to the meal. The staff were very polite and proffesional. Just be careful about asking for reccomendations for local restaurants. There is obviously a standard response for one fish resturant but further questioning gleamed more choices and uncovered a gem (mortons). Overall a nice hotel but lacking in that final touch, it seems that if you want them to give you that little extra to make it a great hotel, it is gonna cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: matkatati
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Olive 8 three nights pre cruise with my 2 small (4 and 5 yrs) children. I know, crazy -- did not plan it this way, but my mother had to cancel last minute. This hotel saved our vacation!! Service was just amazing -- for example getting to be seated to the furthest table available, even if it was a bit of a walk to the waiter! Front desk gave us a great corner room and my kids and I just loved it. To top this all, the hotel is one of the greenest hotels in Seattle and location excellent! Thank you! --

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight after a cruise. I picked it for its central location and past Trip Advisor reviews. A great choice! Two year old, modern hotel. The rooms are large with dark furniture and a beautiful large bathroom. Ours had a refrigerator and coffee maker. Liked the bathroom amenities also (shampoo, lotion, toothpaste, cotton balls). Since this is a "green" hotel, you use your room key to turn on the lights. I asked for a room on a high floor, and had a nice view of the city. The hotel is about 10 blocks from the Pike Market (fun place to see and eat), and a few blocks from several restaurants. We ate breakfast at the Dragonfish restaurant around the corner, as it was cheaper than eating in the hotel. The hotel does have a smallish restaurant and an are to buy muffins and coffee. The central shopping district is about 5 blocks away (Nordstrom, Macy's, etc) as is Westlake Village, a mall. It was easy to get back to the airport. The friendly front desk called a cab which arrived in a minute. Definitely a good choice for Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room on the 8th floor (for 1 night). No spectacular view but the room was awesome. Super spacious, very tasteful designed interior and a great luxurious bathroom. The location is in walking distance to Pike's Market and lots of shops and restaurants. We really enjoyed the comfortable pool area. Only lack was the breakfast. The staff was slow and undedicated. The food ok. On the other hand the bar people were very friendly and very committed. Overall a great place to stay though we really recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Leed Certified, new and awesome in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: verymary
Reviews.Content: The Olive 8 was exceptional in design and decor. We stayed several nights and were absolutely impressed with this hotel. Conveniently located (Dragonfish is right around the corner with fantastic food & a great happy hour menu - cheap! - and Whole Foods is nearby, too), it was an ideal base for us while working at the Convention Center. And it's a Hyatt so the service is first class. This hotel was brand new during our stay and it's planet friendly concept felt very European. For instance, the lights won't even say hello unless your room key is in place -- smart -- though that could bug some Americans. (The idea that the hotel pays less for power so we pay less for a room is enough for me to be sure my key is 'plugged in'. Why don't all new commercial buildings do this??) The walls seemed a bit thin but none of our neighbors were rock stars with noisy habits and neither were we so that wasn't a big deal either. The place is pretty amazing with floor to ceiling windows, beautiful appointments and a bath fit for a king. Only 2 or 3 blocks from the shopping zone - Westlake Center, Macy's, Nordstrom, etc., and many good places to eat within walking distance, Olive 8 is a no-brainer for a wonderful stay in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rickyj
Reviews.Content: Found a room for this hotel on a "hotel" site. The site claimed that the hotel room we were booking had a jetted tub and glass walk-in shower. However, upon check-in we found out that the room we booked was not as advertised and if we wanted a jetted tub it would be another $200...this hotel is not worth that price. So, we settled for the glass walk-in shower. Room was clean and had no smell. Bed was very comfortable and provided a great nights sleep. Amenities were good. View was nice for being in the middle of downtown. Hotel was quite busy, but you would never have known it. Overall it was a great experience. The hotel is close to everything so we were able to walk to all of the places we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Olive 8 in Seattle was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ee2567
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 was very, very nice. The decor was very modern. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The location was great! We would highly recommend this hotel for a great stay! We were able to book our room quite a while in advance and the pricing was fabulous for the wonderful amenties of this Hotel! We loved everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Zoegirl00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in December 2010. It was our first time in Seattle and also the first night of our holiday. We were greeted warmly on our arrival and check in was fast and hassle-free. We stayed in a Deluxe King Room. The room was wonderful. There was plenty of space and everything was clean and well-presented. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was fine for two adults. Great shower too! The staff were very friendly and always happy to help. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Bob1948_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern. The rooms are spacious with all the amenities and modern furnishings. A lot of thought has been put into the layout of the room (electrical outlets,workstation etc). The fitness center and pool were great, with equipment better than the best sports clubs. I felt the restaurant was a little pricey, even for the area. Location is very good-only a block from shopping and a 10 minute walk to Pike Place Market. Service was excellent-evryone on the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: senor_boom
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a modern vibe. The hotel itself is gorgeous with a sleek, uncluttered look. The rooms are beautiful and well appointed with a fantastic bathroom. The lighting in the rooms enhances it quite a bit. I had a corner room with about 30 feet of wrap around windows- the whole hotel has an abundance of windows and natural lighting. The pool/spa is very nice and fosters relaxation. Overall, one of the better hotels I've stayed in and a great place to unwind after traveling

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but not for me”
Reviews.Author: curliegirl
Reviews.Content: First I want to say this is a great hotel - new,clean and modern. My husband and I stayed there for two nights in August. The room was small but very clean and well kept. We paid a little over $200 per night for a basic room with a king bed. The location was good, but still a good walk (about 8 long blocks) to the pier. This will probably sound really picky, but it might help someone trying to decide if they want to stay here. Although the bathrooms were pretty to look at I did not like them at all. The door was not really a door, it was a sliding partition. It really meant no privacy while using the bathroom. I could even hear my husband brushing his teeth through the door. Everything in the bathroom was in one room (no separate room for toilet). We are married, but really there are some things you just do not want to hear. Also there was only one sink and no bathtub - I guess because the hotel is green? I know to some people this would not bother them, but I would rather stay somewhere else next time. I still gave the hotel a high rating because I know this is just personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Modern and Eco-friendly”
Reviews.Author: hillndawn
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Olive 8 is located in downtown Seattle, convenient to shopping, restaurants and transportation. Only a block away is a bus transit hub and the Monorail is within a few blocks. The hotel has a sleek, modern feel and is the only hotel in Seattle to be certified a "green" hotel. We had a spacious corner room and the amenities are all one would expect from Hyatt. The large pool is configured for lap swimming but the kids managed to have fun in one lane & stay out of the way of the serious swimmers. There is also a spa and gym. The restaurant, Urbana, is expensive, at least for breakfast, but the food was good. There is an expresso bar in the lobby. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Sleek”
Reviews.Author: EarthRider
Reviews.Content: If you're used to a grand lobby and large dedicated spaces, this Hyatt will surprise you. It's a multi-purpose building that includes the hotel, a health club with outside membership, and a number of floors of condo apartments. The most stricking feature is the very unique lighting of the hotel at night, consisting of many ribbons of blue fixtures which extend from the top to the bottom of the hotel. The reception area and modest reatuarant/bar are ultra modern. The staff was efficient, profession, and friendly. The rooms are equally modern. I'd describe them as a fusion of a beautifully decorated office and an equally beautiful and functional bedroom. There were many thoughful and well designed features for a comfortable stay. It's slightly out of the "large hotel" area in town but also closer to some of the local attractions in Seattle. I was completely satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: reviewerDC
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here as part of a business trip. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Sarah who helped get a room ready after I arrived from a long flight and needed to get ready before meetings. Rooms are very nice -- clean, modern and tastefully decorated. And I appreciated the small touches (like toothpaste!). Location is superb to convention center, shopping, light rail, and waterfront. Pool is beautiful and was quiet with only a few people there ("locker room" is shared with spa and was also very nice and clean). Only complaint is that I had trouble connecting to the wi-fi. In short, great hotel & friendly staff. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle quite often and know the city fairly well. This hotel was booked by someone else at our company to accomadate several us for a conference. Overall, my experience was very poor and will not stay here again. Two years before this trip I stayed at the other Hyatt in the city (around the corner) and it was a great experience. I would go there in a heartbeat over this hotel. Upon arriving at 2pm (check-in is at 3pm) I was turned away as my room wasn't ready. I was told I would be called when my room was available. I should note that my two co-workers who checked in after me were allowed into their rooms. I returned at 530 (no phone call) and at last my room was ready. I was then assigned a wheel chair accessible room but not told this when I was check-in. The room wasn't terrible but having seen my co-workers rooms where I stored my luggage, this room was a downgrade from standard rooms which isn't fair to anyone. The room was impeccibly clean and the staff did a fantastic job there but customer service the rest of the trip was lacking. The room service food is nothing to note, even in a city like Seattle. The gym was spacious, clean and sunny. Not an afterthought like some hotels. Overall, I was truly disappointed with my stay, especially having stayed at Hyatts in other parts of the country, even in Seattle itself. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite plush hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gmce02
Reviews.Content: This is a rather new hotel with all the associated benefits. The room I had was extremely large and very tastefully decorated. The bathroom was spacious and very modern. Overall the room was comfortable, plush and quiet. This hotel is, additionally, in a great location for both the Convention Centre and downtown Seattle. The lobby is small (but who needs a large one?) and there is a bar and restaurant on site. The pool is particularly good, quite large, and with salt water, there is a steam bath, jacuzzi and sauna also (all included in the room price). I was very happy with the hotel choice, but I had an excellent conference rate. In addition, I was a little skeptical of the hotel's green credentials (it is standard in Europe to have the room electricity turn off on leaving). On the other hand they are at least conscious of these issues. While I had free wifi as part of a conference deal, it is typically charged at a rate of $9.99 per day, which is an annoyance.If you get a good rate, definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: freestylecruizer
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood Prefered Guest, I usually stay at their properties; however this time I was given the opportunity to stay at a new Hyatt property. Never staying at a Hyatt, I didn't know what to expect, but I would obviously compare it recent stays at other hotels. Check-in - Confusing. I must have waited for about 20 mins before someone asked me if I needed assistance, only to have that person run away to "something urgent", so another person assisted. Parking - atrociously high - $35/night Lobby - sparse, uninviting, pretentious. Room - SMALL. King bed, with 42" LED TV. Room is narrow, but deep, still small. Pillows are hard. A/C needs to be forced on, as this is a "green" hotel. Room lights are activated with key card (like Mexico!). TV channel selection sparse. Bathroom is spacious, but no hooks for towels to dry (supposed to be green), and a silly sliding non-insulated door to close off the bathroom from the sleeping area. Pool - Nice. Salt water and relaxing. Check out - Nothing, no "How was your stay" or anything like that. Simple things like this go the distance for a potential returning customer. Location - Great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spaces and a wonderful, friendly sta..”
Reviews.Author: travellingfun
Reviews.Content: I adored this hotel, which I stayed in for a large conference. Smaller than the other conference hotels, the spaces were warm beaufiful, modern styles executed with warmth. My room was comfortable with plenty of space and microareas to inhabit. Public spaces: Coffee shop in the lobby has amazing coffee (yes, this is Seattle) with very reasonable prices (even cheaper refills!) and no feeling of rush. The fitness center was beautiful, with two wonderful facilities. Staff: Helpful and engaging. Something special: Took a water aerobics class, which was great.($10) I can't comment on cost because I had a confwrence rate. This is just a wonderful hotel. I loved staying there. This was a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: queenV2
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel. Clean lines, minimal modern decor, nice staff, big rooms. We are a family of six and we spent one night at Olive 8 before we left for our Alaska cruise. It was perfect! We had adjoining rooms which were awesome. They were clean and had lots of space. The price was extremely reasonable for these rooms. Location of the hotel was also great. You walk a couple of blocks down to Pike Market. There was shopping available right around the corner. The monorail to Space Center was also close by. When I go back to Seattle (because one night was too short), we will definitely stay at Olive 8!

Reviews.Title: “Environmentally Friendly Hotel - Not so friendly to families”
Reviews.Author: Eloise_takes_a_bawth
Reviews.Content: A one night stay at this hotel was one night too many. Having booked through the hotel's site and subsequently communicateed with someone from the hotel on email if was a shock for the front desk to tell us at check in that we needed to pay for an upgraded room if we wanted a bed for our 4 year old. Given that we consider a bed to be a basic need for our child we coughed up the cash. When we arrived the front desk indicated that a room would be ready, even though we were early. Once we had queried the "upgrade" the room was suddenly no longer ready. How odd.... The rooms themselves are small and nothing to write home about. Upon departure my daughter left her treasured stuffy in the bed. Despite an urgent phone call, which was returned with the assurance that the bear had been found, we were called a second time to inform us that a 6 inch bear in a pink onesie had been mistaken for a bathroom towel ! The bear has certainly been in the bed that morning - we can only assume it was in the hotel trash can by the evening. Given our experience with the hotel staff, and the fact we had to console our sobbing daughter for weeks, we wouldn't go back. I'm glad the hotel cares so much for the environment - shame it's not so keen on humans (especially small ones).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoWire
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to stay at the Hyatt at Olive 8, but I will return. The staff was particularly pleasant, even if the valet attendant strayed a little too far into politics for the initial visit. Everyone that worked there really appear to enjoy being a part of the experience. The room, a corner king, was very well laid out, functional, and comfortable. The view was not terrific, but the site itself doesn't have much of a view. My only complaint would be about the quality of the bath linens. They were surprisingly thin, considering the otherwise high quality of the room. All in all, a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolin L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the far end of the downtown shopping district, several blocks from Pike Street market, but all still within walkable distances. Our room was adequate, but small and dark. There were only two small bed-side lamps and a floor lamp in the living area and one small chair. The pillows were riduculous, 5 small limp pillows on a king sized bed. The doors into the hallway were very thin and we were woke by every small noise in the hallway. The pool was average, nothing special, however the steam room and sauna were lovely. We were provided only 1 robe in the room. Breakfast was hit and miss, the first morning we had the crab eggs benedict which was perfect. Second morning we had the waffle with fresh berries. One small waffle with about 8 fresh berries, and we left hungry. Overall, I would look elsewhere for both comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “place was very clean, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brigette1972
Reviews.Content: the rooms were very stylish and clean and very comfortable. Great location. Great price for what you get. The only negative aspect of this hotel is that your internet is not for free you have to pay. i wouldnt stay here again though as I think the money you pay you should get some free wifi where i stayed elsewhere that was cheaper and they offered it.

Reviews.Title: “So Cool and Eco Friendly”
Reviews.Author: debshirle
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this modern, exceptionally clean facility in Seattle. The location is ten minutes on foot from the Pike Market and you can go anywhere in downtown Seattle by foot or a short cab ride. I selected this hotel using Trip Advisor and other travel sites and am not disappointed. The facility has a swimming pool with underwater music and Seattle's Best Spa. Really enjoying being here at the end of my Alaska cruise. By the way the staff is very courteous and helpful in Coffee City.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: DebraCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I thought I was the fussiest person when it comes to hotels but in reading the reviews, I must say I was wrong! Although upscale hotels charge for internet (and I really do not know why), this hotel offers free wi fi in the secluded part of the lobby. My room was spotless, exceptionally quiet, spacious, and the shower had excellent pressure. The bed might be the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in. The towels were fluffy and soft. Any request was promptly fulfilled. The staff was gracious and not snooty. It was easy to go anywhere in all of Seattle. We stayed for 2 nights. We loved it. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and this little boutique hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellersf00
Reviews.Content: I was really happy that I chose to stay at this hotel when I was in Seattle for a conference. It is so much better than the Grand Hyatt which is just across the street. Olive 8 felt like a smaller boutique hotel and the room was modern and clean. I really loved their bathroom too. The location is very central, a short walk to the convention center, shopping, and restaurants. You must check out their gym. I work out regularly, but never when I travel. However, I made an exception because the gym was so nice! Good cardio and weight machines, warm towels, water, and even a yoga studio. They have a nice indoor pool as well. I would definitely stay at Olive 8 again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay would have been perfect”
Reviews.Author: mprice68
Reviews.Content: Everything was great i have stayed in hyatts before the only have two complainst i have is the valet charges are 50 a day and they charge for internet per day the westins i stay in are free alot of the times i think the hotel should offer a discount when you stay with them i do relize we are in a big city but still its the princeple not the money .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Service & Location A++”
Reviews.Author: miamiicpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Olive 8 pre and post Alaska Cruise. The hotel is very nice with a modern feel. The staff is top notch. The concierge was friendly and helpful. We loved going to the lobby bar for a pre and post dinner drink. The rooms were very nice, the bathroom were also of nice size. We paid approx $200 per night. At this price point definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MarcyKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Olive and 8 Hyatt at the recommendation of a friend who lives in Seattle. We loved the location- centrally located but just off the main drag. The room was clean, bright and beautifully decorated with Asian simplicity. We couldn't believe when we checked out that the hotel was full. It was so quiet and the elevators were always there when we needed one. (I hate standing and waiting for elevators). We didn't eat at the restaurant, but did get a good recommendation from the desk when we asked. I found that the room rate on the hotel's website was less than anything I found at any other website.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: Harboo
Reviews.Content: Gym and coffee bar were excellent, and the room was comfortable. We were not fans of the low flow showers, but that is the price of being green I guess. We truly appreciated it when the hotel maid found and the staff ultimately kept safe and then returned two diamond and gold bracelets that were left on the floor during a packing rush. I continue to be annoyed at wifi charges (...if McDonalds can give it for free, then seriously...), but at least in this case you can get it free in the lobby. Overall a good value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than most business hotels, but a few gaps”
Reviews.Author: dallenboston
Reviews.Content: I have rated this hotel a four because I really would go back there and be perfectly happy about it. But my true judgement would be more like a 3.5. This is not the typical Hyatt megahotel. It's smaller in size, and has a more boutique, personal feel, which I liked, but it's not quite the hip place it tries to be. Some of the differences work well: rooms are smallish but perfectly adequate and the trade-off of having a good fitness center and restaurant were perfectly acceptaable to me. There were some gaps, though. The bathroom had a shower but no tub, and the shower had only a half-way glass panel, making it feel a bit exposed. Perhaps this is part of the hotel's environmental theme but It just seem stingy to me. And the TV had the worst array of channels I've ever found in a hotel. I mean really -- the Speed channel? It was all about trucks. I could have ordered one of the on-demand, in-room movies for my one night off from work in Seattle, but at $17 plus I couldn't bring myself to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: jl049
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 is a very nice hotel in a great location. For less than $3, you can take the light rail train from SEATAC airport to the Westlake Center in downtown Seattle that is only a 5-minute walk from the Hyatt. You are also within walking distance of many of the city's best attractions including Pike Place Market. The Hyatt offers rcomfortable rooms in tasteful decor. There's a great fitness room in the hotel with loads of equipment plus a first-class pool. Don't forget to take a walk on 9th Avenue (about 5 blocks from the Hyatt) over to the Whole Foods Store, a great place for reasonably priced meals and a great selection.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kellker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and I loved the modern decor. I'm very picky about hotel cleanliness and the Hyatt at Olive 8 was spotless. The bed was fabulously comfortable.
