Morning #3: Maid knocked on the door around 8am. We were there 7 nights and had to call everyday for 2 extra sets of towels. Shower had a small basket to hold soap, could not fit much in it so we had to put stuff on the ground. Bathroom needed another towel bar. Room did not have many drawers to hold clothes. When we tried to use the blow dryer in the room so someone else could shower a fuse kept blowing. For a green hotel, they had the heat blasting in public areas. The locker room, pool & hot tub were nice. It would have been helpful if the hotel posted how to get a key for the locker in the locker room. Did find the front desk associates particularly friendly. Concierge Earl was awesome. Valets were great as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Garrick_nyc
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and the rooms were new, clean, modern and visually appealing. I upgraded to a corner room and it was worth the USD 19 per night. Having windows on two sides gives the room more light and at least a perception of bigger space. Downside is none of the rooms really have great exterior views. There are too many tall buildings around. Do not expect a view of the Puget Sound.

Reviews.Title: “Eco-concious, Quality, Quality, Superb Location, Staff & Price, Strange Billing Mishaps, which got remedied”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed her on October 10th, checking out on October 11th, 2010. This is an excellent hotel. Minimalistic lobby, in a hip, eco-conscious sort of way. The staff here are excellent. It is probably the best service I have ever experienced. I am sensitive to chemicals from work-related chemical exposures, and the WA Toxic Coalition recommended this hotel, saying it is one of 3 hotels in the Pacific NW that is eco-friendly. From the minute I called, to the minute I checked out, and then afterwards, dealing with billing mishaps, the staff were superb. I saw one website that this hotel only used non-chemical cleaners in their rooms. When I double checked, the front desk person checked with the housekeeping staff, and unfortunately they did use regular cleaning products; but when I asked if the room could be prepared in a special way, they happily said that it could. I prefer to book reservations on-line. (I.e. no mishaps in name, billing address, etc. plus, I get a chance to pick the room. And now, since becoming sensitive to cleaning products, I could type in comments with the way I could ask the room to be prepared.) After I made the reservation, I called the hotel back and the front desk person also made a special note about how the room would be prepared. I have literally never received such excellent service as I did from this hotel, except at the Nile Cairo; but even so, this hotel exceeded that one in service, and just about everything else, for that matter. At any rate, my mom and I showed up, and just to make sure, we inquired if the room was indeed prepared the way we asked. (It is a pain being sensitive to chemicals, which I only just acquired recently, but I so appreciated this hotel in accommodating me with this.) The front desk clerk checked with housekeeping, and then double checked with the manager. I couldn't believe the service we received. She said the room had not been shampooed and the sheets had been washed in baking soda, and I believe the bathroom was cleaned the same way, as I had asked. Again, the service was outstanding. You would think that you would only get this type of service if you were the president or staying at a $400-$500 room or something. And, they did so, so happily, like they were really happy to see you, and serve you. Amazing. I've never really received service like that before. Thus, we go up to the room and it was lovely. Very cool and hip furnishings. Big, flat screen TV. We might sound like "hicks," ha, ha, but we've never watched TV on an HDTV before. Of course friends have told us about it. And, we must be behind the times, as we laughed and giggled at the quality of it. We were watching something on the Discovery channel, underwater something or another, and we honestly couldn't tell if it was a cartoon or not! It was that good. The rest of the room had excellent quality everything. There were two comfortable queen beds. Lovely crisp white cotton duvets with pretty bedspreads folded at the bottom of the bed. I believe down pillows. A hip cool chair with an end table. Picture windows with nice views of downtown Seattle. I wished the windows would have opened, but they didn't. They did, it seemed, have some sort of fresh air that came in through the vents, though. The bathroom was nice. Like what you would see on the House Hunters show. Very hip and cool, too. One of those sliding opaque, semi-see-through doors. Marble, I believe, floors, and vanity with the sink. A low flow toilet, which went along with the eco-minded theme of the hotel. A large tub, which I wished I could have soaked in, but in the interest of time, I didn't. The hair dryer was very nice. High powered, but not very loud. A rubber handle, which felt nice on the hands. A very nice, one-pot coffee pot. I wish I could have bought the hairdryer and coffee pot from the Hyatt catalog. The rooom was so nice and we were only there one night, it was like, "what to do? what to do? Soak in the tub, eat room service, watch the nice TV, or go to the spa?" which by the way was nice, too. They had a steam room and a sauna, with their nice thick Hyatt towels and bathrobes. I skipped the sauna and we ate room service, twice. Equally excellent. Very nice quality. Nice wait staff. The prices were excellent. We're used to paying, I guess high prices up here. We don't really think they are high. We're just used to it, then getting semi-mediocore food. But when you go down to the lower 48, or in particular this hotel, and get the food you do, for the prices quoted, you're impressed. (However, I was just in upstate NY, MD, PA, and Pasadena, CA in April and May, and got sort of high priced food that was mediocore, so this hotel really stood out.) The food came and we were "wowed." The servers brought it on a lovely pewter tray, with lovely heavy silverware and pewter salt and pepper shakers. We had the open faced steak sandwich and fish and chips for dinner. Excellent. For breakfast we had the eggs benedict and the florentine scramble. Very good waitstaff and food. It was a little weird, though, when the food arrived for breakfast the waiter said, "no toast, just as you ordered," which I didn't say "no toast" on the phone, which was strange, but no matter. We split all the meals to enjoy all of it. The location is excellent. The first night we walked a block too far and turned back to the hotel. The next day, before checking out, we used their directions and the map they gave us, which was to take a left at the lobby and a left at the first street, and walk 7 blocks. It seemed like we walked uphill and downhill both ways! We laughed as we thought this was kind of funny. It seemed a bit like San Francisco. It was really close and an enjoyable walk. What else? Oh yeah, the strange billing mishaps. When we went to check out the bill was more than I thought. I was there on business and was getting reimbursed for the room, so I thought maybe they didn't give me the business rate. When I asked and checked the bill, I did get the business rate. So when I asked again about the bill, the front desk gal said it was just for some "miscelaneous phone charges." We had taken a taxi service 4 times in basically one day, or less than 24 hours, from the time we arrived, so the nice taxi cab driver was waiting outside for us again. I didn't want to make him wait again, as he had already waited for awhile before an appointment that morning. At any rate, I just took the bill and left and got in the taxi cab to the airport. When I looked over the bill, I called the hotel immediately. There were 64 phone charges! Very strange. They were all to the same number, which wasn't even a correct 10 digit number. The calls started at 6:02 am, the time I called for breakfast, and ended up 6:34 AM, to the same number, some calling the same minute, like 6:02, 6:02, 6:03, 6:04, 6:04. My mom was in the shower and then we were eating breakfast, and then we went by taxi cab to our appointment. I spoke to a Steven, at the front desk, and he thought it was very strange, too. My mom and I laughed, as it looked like I was "stalker" or a "harrasser" or something, calling somebody that many times, which I wasn't calling anybody! Anyway, Steven said he would take care of it, correct it, and e-mail me the bill, so that I could present it for reimbursement to my employer. I got back to Kodiak and checked my e-mail and the bill did not come through. I called and the front desk person remembered me and said Steven was helping me. They put me through to accounting and that person e-mailed me the correct version of the bill. However, the original high charge was still charged to my credit card. Then there was a mysterious $8.00 charge, on top of the incorrect high charge. Very strange. The only thing I could think of was that either the dinner or breakfast person was triple of double tipped. (It's no big deal, but I accidently double tipped the dinner person as a 20% service charge is added to the bill, and I tipped on top of it. No big deal. For breakfast, I saw the 20% tip was already added, so I didn't add anything additionally.) $8.00 is no big deal, but it was just strange, and I thought after the goofy phone charges, it was just another strange billing deal. I e-mailed the accounting person again, a bit embarressed about a measly $8.00 charge, but again, after the over $64.00 in phone charges, it just seemed strange to keep getting weird charges on my credit card. Plus, I thought the food was great, but a double or a triple tip was a bit excessive. I just checked my credit card and now instead of an $8.00 credit, I now have an over $19.00 credit! Very odd. Oh well. Despite these odd billing practices, which I, and the front desk Steven, (in regards to the strange phone calls,) couldn't figure out, this was a most excellent hotel and I would highly recommend it. In fact, I have already recommended it to 3 people who were flying to Seattle this month, and their spouses. I also recommended it to someone who could put the word out about ecologically friendly hotels for other people consciencious about this on a website. Again, the billing was very strange, but the food, service, staff, location, quality of the rooms, furnishings, linens, and price made up for this. Again, I would highly recommend it and I will stay here in the future. In fact, this may be the only hotel I will ever stay in if I go to the Seattle area again. One thing, however, is the only thing this hotel didn't have was an airport shuttle, which I don't know if this is ubiqutious for Seattle hotels or not? No matter, as we used a taxi. When I called to inquire, after booking, they said there is an airporter shuttle that goes to the downtown area, I think dropping off at a hotel near there, for $15 per person. They also mentioned a metro? for a couple of dollars, leaving the airport, right near there as well. Well, you can't go wrong with this hotel. There is no need to eat anywhere else either. Literally, you won't be dissatisfied. Oh, and by the way, the gov't rate was $159. An excellent deal for such a high quality hotel, in a great location, with excellent staff and high quality rooms. All in all, two thumbs up. Highly recommended. My mom and I still talk about the food, the TV, and those pewter serving trays and salt and pepper shakers! I wish they would have sold it in their Hyatt catalog. Good job Hyatt. I looking forward to going back if I ever have to stay in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Environmentally Conscious”
Reviews.Author: honu024
Reviews.Content: The excellent service started with a phone call to the hotel during which I was given several options for traveling from the airport to Hyatt at Olive 8. Each day, the friendly service of the concierge and other staff made our stay at this LEED-certified hotel well worth our investment, and the proximity to great restaurants and attractions was another selling point. We were able to walk to almost all the attractions and venues we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: sundevil92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for three nights. We got a great rate through AAA, which also included breakfast. Let me just start by saying that the beds were so wonderful. I don't think I sleep that well at my own home. Location was wonderful. It was within walking distance from most CBD locations, including the underground bus tunnel and most other transit (you can ride free from 6AM-7PM every day within the CBD). We ate breakfast in the dining room each morning. There was kind of a ditzy girl working as hostess and one day we had really bad service, including being forgotten by our waitperson. But they did send up a nice fruit plate and cookies to apologize. The food, however, is just wonderful. The only negatives I can think of are that they charge for internet service. I think this is really stupid. A lot of hotels are moving away from this and I think it goes a LONG way to offer free internet. The other negative was the doors on the bathroom. It's a sliding door, which seems weird to me for a hotel. I don't think the designers put much thought into the customer experience when recommending those doors. Overall, it was a nice hotel in a good location and I would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, yet...”
Reviews.Author: jodastephen
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews capture, this is a quality hotel, and you get good rooms. Yet I couldn't love it. The location is on Olive and Eight, hence the name. Its a great location for the city, with the main street to the harbour (Pine) being half a block away (parallel to Olive), and the absolute centre of shopping no more than 3 or 4 (small) blocks. Pike Market is about 8, and very walkable. The area felt safe to walk into town (although I wouldn't choose to walk away from town as there is the I-5 to cross after a couple of blocks). The room is a reasonable size for a city centre, and you're not going to stay for the views. The shower was good, especially with the ability to turn it on and test the water before getting wet. The furniture was also good quality, yet still corporate. The air-con wasn't too loud, yet was efficient. Reception was well staffed, and efficient. The concierge was OK, but didn't exactly own the problem I gave him (I expected more given the reviews). The pool was good. We ate in the Urbane restaurant on the first night. The food was good, if a smidgen expensive. Recommended, but with a slightly narrow menu, worth checking before going in that there is something you want. We ate at Fiorinos Italian the other two nights at Olive and 6th, as it was more our style. I suppose I'm really wondering why I'm not raving like many other reviews. Perhaps the expectations were too high? One reason is cost. It is expensive, and a lot pricier than hotels on the California/Oregon coast where we'd come from. No surprise you may say, but given it was the same price as the most picture perfect place ever right on the waterfront at Lake Como, Italy (which would be perfect for honeymooners) it just felt very expensive. And then they go and charge $10 per day for internet. Really, its 2010! Management, its time to stop charging for an essential service. Oh, and they even charge a $1 connection fee for a 1-800 number. As if they need to with the amount they charge. Overall, its a meh. Very nice and worthy of a 4/5 rating yet I was hoping to give it a 5. We probably should have stayed in a cheaper place where we would get free wifi. Should you stay? Perhaps if you get a better rate than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: jki_travels
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was great -- spacious, comfortable bed -- great place to recharge the batteries. We took advantage of the room service and the hotel pool. Everything was very enjoyable! This hotel is only a few blocks from the monorail that takes you to the Space Needle, and a short walk past the monorail will take you to Pike Place market. While the hotel isn't right in the center of the tourist spots, we didn't mind the walk. We had sunshine both days! We would recommend this hotel as long as you don't mind walking a bit to get where you want to go. Next stop on our adventure is the Olympic Peninsula...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: steg
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for five days. The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The service is outstanding. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Beds were very comfortable and the hotel was quiet throughout the night. The hotel restaurant had outstanding food and service. The only downside of our entire stay was the $10 daily fee for internet and the lack of children's programming on the TV. The only children's station was pay per view PBS.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds!”
Reviews.Author: consumerchamp
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Seattle on short notice. Booked Hyatt at Olive 8 because of the Hyatt affiliation. I'm coming back in December because as another review put it, it still manages to have a boutique hotel feel. The corner room upgrade is worth the extra few dollars: almost more room than I could handle, though the view was just okay. Staff was sharp: good answers to questions, great service. Another plus is that this hotel is about a block and a half from the light rail terminal. From the airport to downtown in 22 minutes for a couple of dollars. Pleasant plus were the pool and jacuzzi. Only one minus: no Regency Club. Of course I kind of like the fact that management reads these reviews and responds.

Reviews.Title: “Outstading property!”
Reviews.Author: hunterjackson
Reviews.Content: Great property with great amenities. Stunning rooms, plush bedding, decadent shower. Great food at Urbane. We ate 2 meals here. Wow! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “On my top ten lists of overall hotel experiences anywhere in the US”
Reviews.Author: Momokidsncats
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband who had a conference in the hotel. While he spent his days talking technical with the rest of his fellow engineers, I enjoyed the hotel and the beautiful city of Seattle. This hotel is one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. Everything was modern and fresh from the cotton sheets to the large tiled shower to the very large flat-screen TV. I spent one morning in the fitness center which includes headphones to use while you watch TV built in on each machine. I got enough exercise just walking around the city the rest of the time. The hotel is very well situated. You really don't need to rent a car here. In fact, my husband turned the car back in the second day because we didn't need it. When it was time to fly home, we just walked around the corner and took the light rail system directly to the airport. It is only a few blocks to Pikes Market or the Ferry Terminal. I spent my days exploring the city. I took the ferry out to Bainbridge Island as well as the monorail to the Space needle. One day was spent on a tour I arranged to Mt. Rainier. The tour company picked me up at the hotel. Urbane was a very good restaurant. The food was fresh and delicious. The only glitch we had was the fire alarm went off one night. We were unsure what to do so we followed the rest of the crowd and went down 14 flights of stairs before it stopped. We were told it was a wiring problem. I would definitely go back again and stay in this hotel if the chance comes up again.

Reviews.Title: “The BOMB!”
Reviews.Author: napatodd
Reviews.Content: This place is over the top. I had ordered flowers for my wife for our anniversary (From "Buckets"- Awesome!) and had them delivered to the hotel, they were in our room after we checked-in. Joey and Matt did a great job. After they asked what the special occasion was, they sent up champagne and chocolates! They even remembered my name later when I came down to the lobby. I responded to an invitation for an upgrade to a corner room for $25 a night more, WOW! That is worth every penny! Two entire walls of windows and a bathroom you could have a party in! The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. This place really trumps the "when ever, what ever" hotel to the south. Location is tough to beat also. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 (which is Olive Street & 8th Avenue) is an upscale, yet small (almost boutique style) hotel in the great Hyatt chain. The service folks were helpful & friendly. The lobby is trendy with a coffee bar on one side and a restaurant (which I did not try) on the other side. They have a spa and gym although I did not try either as you get a pretty good workout just walking in Seattle. The rooms are comfortable, clean and had all the necessary amenities. The bed was very comfortable, there was a large HD TV on the wall, the bathroom was nice size (no bathtub which is fine by me). Very "green" throughout. Did not dine in the hotel as there are several great options just a few blocks away. Did appetizers at Hard Rock Cafe, Ruth's Chris, PF Changs and McCormick & Schmicks. Tough to give it 5 stars just because I usually reserve those for the big, elegant resorts but this is pretty close to that quality.

Reviews.Title: “Confused Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: chewpei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights in August. We booked the larger corner room and it was the biggest room we've ever been in I think. Lovely furnishings, but as a previous reviewer mentioned, they really need another mirror outside the bathroom. Difficult for multiple people getting ready in the morning! We had three nights prepaid and two nights for free with our Hyatt points. This confused the check in people totally. They thought we had two separate rooms. It took a while to check in, even after we explained this -- perhaps we had someone new. After the three nights we were supposed to be switched to a smaller room, as the big rooms aren't given for points. I totally understand this, and we packed our things. When we arrived back at the hotel later that day we were told we weren't swtitched. Fine, but I would have preferred we hadn't had to pack -- I would think a look at the computer's reservations would have told them that by noon, when we went out for a few hours. When we checked out a couple days later there was again general confusion at the desk. We had prepaid so there wasn't any money due -- we hadn't eaten there or used any other services. The man checking us out looked baffled and I reviewed that we had prepaid and used points. He couldn't get our final "bill" printed and asked for our email address to send it. We got home and no email, but I knew there wasn't any charge, so who cared? Well, imagine my surprise when I got my credit card bill and there was a $64 charge. I called the hotel, who wanted to transfer me to a general billing number, which I didn't think would be the best way to handle it. I asked to speak with a manager, and they took a message, but of course he never called back. I called again and got an assistant manager, who again was quite confused. I wondered if w'd been charged for internet access, which we were told was free as we are platinum members because of our frequency of stays. Finally, after being put on hold, he said they had charged us "something" for the free nights?? He wouldn't say why and what it was, but he would take it off the credit card, which he did. All this put a damper on our stay. I shouldn't have had to hassle with them over the bill and expected a return call from the manager, or he should have had someone else call for him. The location is OK -- close to lots of shopping (but the stores are the same as any city in the US), but a bit of a walk to some of the sights. We did ask the concierge a few questions and he was fairly helpful. Didn't know much about the buses, but maybe they attract customers who don't use public transportation. The beds were great and the hotel was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE DOWNTOWN”
Reviews.Author: northportgary
Reviews.Content: I LOVE DOWNTOWN LIFE the noise the smell the people I just love it and the hotel was great we made the reservation in Jan for June an keep getting e mails about our stay this was great then I got a E offer for UP Grade THE BEST MOVE I MADE when We got to our room OMG my wife went nuts it was to die for THANK HYATT THAT WHY WE STAY WITH YOU

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent gym, clean rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: travelingokgal
Reviews.Content: I love the location and cleanliness and "green" approach this hotel embraces. Laurie, was very good and totally accomodating. I had a problem with my TV and Laurie had it fixed in minutes. I was here on business and the solo computer to print from at the concierge desk did not work for me. When I commented that I had never seen a hotel w/o a business center, the concierge responded "Well, now you have!" I was then informed that the Hyatt was in a hurry to get the hotel open, so that is the reason for "no business center". Seriously, charge me, but please have this important service for business travelers! I am in sales, so customer service is something I take quite seriously. This is clearly not the philosophy embraced here at the Hyatt, except for Laurie. THANK YOU LAURIE! I would recommend for fun, but not business.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot go wrong with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GlenArmLady
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Frankly, I have not felt as valued as a customer in ages. The hotel is beautiful, the facilities excellent and the staff superlative. You must try the restaurant Urbane for dinner. We also ate there for breakfast ( which was included in our package) and loved it! It may not be as close to the waterfront as some like but for us it was a relief to get out of the bustle there at the ned of the day. Also close to the convention center which I will keep in mind if I come back on business. I am a real pool person and this one is one of the nicest indoor pools I've experienced. I wanted to live in that pool!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hyatt in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Clubu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before heading to the airport. We arrived on the early side and were able to check in immediately. The staff member at the front desk was very efficient and did not waste any time. For no particular reason, we were given a handicapped accessible room-it was enormous. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone living with a physical disability.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: goblingoblin
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and loved it. Nice room and bathroom with two comfortable queen beds. Room was decent size but not overly large. It was comfortable for our family of four. Room was quiet at night(which I was concerned about after reading some previous reviews). Good location in downtown Seattle. Hotel staff was very helpful, concierge was great. This was our favorite of 7 hotels on our Canada trip. The workout room is amazing with a variety of machines, weights, cold fresh towels. The indoor pool is large with underground music, lots of lounge chairs, and a hot tub. There is also a steam room and very nice showers in the mens/womens locker room. It had a very nice and relaxing spa feel to it. Very upscale. We wish we could have spent more time there! Only complaint is that you have to put your key in the slot above the lightswitch when you go into the room to get the light to work. Please remember that this also works the air conditioner. We forgot and came back to a hot room both days. I would recommend leaving one key in the slot to keep the air conditioner on when you out. I know this is a "green" hotel that is trying to save energy, but you still need to be comfortable at night!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic reception - and it didn't stop there.”
Reviews.Author: ECAH
Reviews.Content: Possibly the friendliest receptionist and greeting we've ever had in the States. Comfortable beds, good location, generous over-sized room in immaculate condition. Good pool with underground music - modern well-equipped gym and changing rooms. Excellent all-round hotel, really hard to fault. Not quite as central as some but esp handy for all shopping. Lovely lobby coffee shop, friendly service with granola to die for! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: janlloyd40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and thought it was fab! Front desk staff were incredibly efficient and friendly and we got into our room at 9.00a.m. after disembarking a cruise ship. Fixtures and fittings were of a high standard - docking stations for ipods,etc. As mentioned by another review, shower was agenius, with shower head on opposite wall to shower controls. It was really conveniently situated for monorail, easy walking distance to Pike Market, etc. Indoor pool and spa were a bonus at the price we paid. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For What We Needed.”
Reviews.Author: derekreeves
Reviews.Content: Nice design, inside and out. The materials used on the place are modern and sexy. I was a huge fan of everything from the shower fixture being on the opposite side as the shower head (so you don't get wet turning it on, genius right?), to the Steelite water glasses on the counter tops. The furniture in the rooms was very nice and we had a decent view out our corner windows. We requested a bellboy to bring us up silverware so we could eat our take-out in our room and it was there in and instant. The location of this hotel isn't the best, but Seattle is a small city so you can get where you need to be fairly quick. When checking into the hotel they weren't overly friendly and when leaving the hotel there was no door man around to help us hail a cab. My wife and I got a good rate on this hotel, so I'm satisfied with what we got. But if I paid $300 a night I would be a lot more critical. I wasn't looking to use internet access, but it bothers me when hotels think they can charge for it these days. Internet is everywhere and hotels need to offers it as a courtesy amenity.

Reviews.Title: “extras costly”
Reviews.Author: ABCSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one year old, so very nice. Spare modern style (which makes public areas a bit noisy) Wonderful location, can walk to Seattle Center and Pioneer square + there are free buses in city center. It is really cheap to charge someone paying $300+ / night to use wifi. Parking is $40/night. And the idea that there are two fox channels and no public broadcasting available on room TV seems to say something It is lovely, but I'd probably stay elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Gordyk
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 is great hotel, stay for a night or a week, you will feel at home from the first day. There are just to many positives to list. The pool, exercise area, spa area are great. A fine coffee shop with great bake goods is available in the lobby first thing in the morning. Hotel is in a good area near some live shows, bookstores but outside the busy Seattle waterfront. The waterfront is a walk but the monorail is just up the street. Hotels in Seattle are expensive but you will get value at the Hyatt at Olive 8.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Starmysha
Reviews.Content: I've attended the conference and stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, everything was exceptional, my only complaints is in this day and age WiFi should be complimentary...

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: andiamoemangiamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 days before and 4 days after a family cruise to Alaska. The hotel is beautifully appointed, the rooms are large and spacious, the concierge was friendly and knowledgeable, and the service was excellent. We had none of the problems the other travelers complained about. My only issue was that the hotel should provide free wi-fi even if it's available only on the lobby level. The hotel is located a little further from Pike Place Market than the other major hotels, but for us, it was a good way to walk off all the wonderful meals and pastries we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Green Olive”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: Staying here was an interesting experience. I arrived early and there were two Hyatt staff members at the desk and a group of other guests clustered near the check-in. I stood back from the group waiting for them to be served. One group was exiting and I was blocked from approaching the desk by a rolling suitcase belonging to the exiting group. In the meanwhile just as my path cleared a woman who had walked off the elevator went to the desk breaking ahead of me. I had made eye contact with the Hyatt receptionist and found it very hard to understand why she did not ask the woman to wait her turn. Instead she and the other guest had a lengthy exchange during which others of her party congregated and one of the party was also assisted by the staffer, with her getting a bellman to locate and return the luggage of one of the gathered party. When they were done I stepped to the desk and I told the woman that I had been next in line and she looked at me blankly. It was not the best of ways to start the stay. I like the hotel and the minimalist look of the lobby. Many of the other guests I encountered were European, most were young. The room was as I requested on a high floor. I liked the shower, and found the water pressure okay. I did not understand how to use the dual flush toilets and it seemed to me that while trying to save on paper, etc. that more explanation of the room and its green elements might help people like me who had never encountered a dual flush toilet, etc. I slept well and did not hear noises from the other rooms. I stored my luggage here initially and found the young man who handled my luggage to be most efficient and friendly. Other staff members seemed to be "too cool to smile". I also stayed at the Hyatt Regency later in this same trip and if asked to recommend a hotel I would recommend the Regency over the Olive property.

Reviews.Title: “Improve housekeeping !!!”
Reviews.Author: Briandw
Reviews.Content: The only reason for four points for this hotel is bad housekeeping. They did not leave enough towels and single use items, such as cotton swabs and cotton balls. I think it's because this hotel is eco-friendly hotel, but a couple of these should have been supplied everyday. On the day I left the hotel, housekeeping knocked on the door at 9:00am and asked when we were leaving. If it was 10:00 or 11:00, it was understandablem but 9:00am was to early for that. Like some people already said, there were not shower door, shower handle and a fan in the bathroom, but water pressure was ok in the shower. Other than these, hotel is quite nice. If you book early and have AAA, rate per night is not beatable. Valet parking is $39 + tax, but you can park at 7th Ave and Pike parking lot(one block away) for $28 with tax included per day with in/out privilege. Park your car and when you exit for the first time, just tell the cashier that you are staying at Hyatt and pay for multiple night in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Green Hotel - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Zingland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and took advantage of the room with breakfast deal. Everything about this property is excellant including the great customer service. Really enjoyed the Urbane restaurant for both light snacks with cocktails and breakfast each morning. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't recommend for lots of reasons - read on...”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: I did not like this place much at all and would not recommend it to anyone unless you get off on "saving the planet" as an uber greenie. LEEP certification means this: No comfort or convenience. Yes the place is nice. Yes it is in a great location. Yes it has nice amenities (spa/restaurant/bar), yeah, yeah, yeah. For $200.00 plus a night you expect that so I won't belabor the point. Look at my pictures. What you need to consider is this: with all that "green" bs you get no pressure and only sporadic heat in the shower. I mean, it came out in cups not gallons. And aerated at that! Give me a break. I need a shower man, not an exercise in trying to get clean. And I want it to feel good. Not here. The walls and doors are so "green" that I could here every bucket of ice get filled at every hour of the night and it was located around the corner and down the hall from our room. Great. The bathroom "door" is a framed panel of glass on a barn door sliding mechanism. You had no "aural" privacy at all. And no fan either. Not comfortable at all. They don't have any kind of business center at all. They offer one (ONE!) laptop at the front desk and wi-fi is $10 a day. Why no more computers than one? "It saves electricity" said the desk clerk. Real green man, real green. Convenient? Not. Once we called down and asked them to call for a cab for us. "We don't call for cabs but will get you one when you come down" Upon arriving at the lobby and asking the desk clerk what the deal was with the calling of cabs I was told, "We don't call for cabs here. They won't respond". Really! That's exactly what I was told! I'm sorry, I just won't recommend this place. Not when the Paramount next door looked so good.

Reviews.Title: “Very swanky!”
Reviews.Author: leftwing
Reviews.Content: We used Hyatt frequent stay points to stay at his luxury hotel. They upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite, which was lovely--esp. when traveling with a kid who loves to watch TV shows we aren't interested in. No complaints from our son about the pullout couch. The only problem was they forgot to give us sheets and a blanket for the sofa, so we had to call down at night. They brought them right away. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom was gigantic. The shower was confusing--there are two separate shower heads and we had trouble getting the main one to work. The hotel staff were super nice and very hip and casual--all very much part of the image that this Hyatt wants to promote. The location is perfect. We walked to the hotel from the new lightrail train station at Westlake Center. All the tourist attractions are in walking distance, so we felt no need for a car.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at it's best!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerWa
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at the Olive 8...it exceeded our expectations in every way. We weren't quite sure what to expect since this was our first stay with them but WOW! Everything was so organized and friendly that you'd swear you were someone important...clearly we're not :). THE ROOM... We originally had booked a regular room but upon check in we were warmly welcomed and informed that we had been upgraded to a corner suite. It was a beautiful room with floor to ceiling windows that looked out to the Paramount Theater. The room was incredibly beautiful! ROOM SERVICE...(big kudos) We decided to get room service that night to enjoy our anniversary evening in a private setting and after placing our order we were informed that we would be receiving a 20% discount on any room service orders during our stay. The food came even earlier than expected and was delicious. The gentleman who delivered our food even offered to open and pour our own bottle of wine at no additional cost...not a common practice in other hotels we've stayed in. OVERALL... Long story short is you absolutely cannot go wrong if you decide to stay at the Hyatt Olive 8...truly one of the best experiences we've ever had. They re-established our confidence that some hotels really do care about their customers and want to do everything they can to ensure you've enjoyed your stay. FRONT DESK... I also wanted to mention that we thoroughly enjoyed the professional and friendly gentleman that checked us in at the front desk. It really started our special weekend out just how we dreamed...thanks for making us feel like we really do matter and we wish you all the best. I can't remember his name right now but I believe he is from Hawaii :)...aloha to our friend!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Downtown Seattle Convention Center Area - Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cmg2101
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention at the Convention Center. The Hyatt at Olive 8 is an amazing facility and I highly recommend staying here. The hotel website tells you a lot about the design, environmental impact and luxury of this facility, however there is plenty that it doesn’t tell you. The staff at the hotel are beyond helpful, friendly and dare I say genuinely interested in making sure you have everything you need. I had key problems at my room door (my fault – don’t keep your room key in your pocked in the hot tub) and they sent someone up to get me in my room within minutes. The room is gorgeous. The king bed was super comfortable, the pillows were perfect and I think I need to buy some for my place. My room had a 37” LG LCD TV. Most network and basic cable stations came in fine however I was having with the ESPN channels. At the side of the bed was an iHome AM/FM iPod dock which was great for my iPhone to charge each night. The room also had a small refrigerator and mini bar area. The bathroom was interesting with a big sliding door which was different. The shower was a stand up shower, glass half enclosure with a stone floor. I like hot showers, it was with delight that I saw the mirror after the shower. The middle section of the mirror did not fog up, the rest did. It was clearly a rectangle and meant to happen. It was great. The fitness and pool facilities are very well designed and luxurious. The pool is a good temperature and slightly salted. Around the pool are lounge chairs which are always stocked with fresh towels. The pool is open at 5:30 am so I was able to turn some laps before the conference each day. The locker room has a steam room, sauna, showers, lockers and basic essentials like razors, combs, shaving cream, after shave… etc. There are also water coolers in the gym and locker room. There is also a full spa with massages and treatments for extra, I did not partake in any of that. The cons: I feel that a place as expensive at the Hyatt at Olive 8 shouldn’t “nickel and dime” you for certain things. It is 2010, wi-fi should be included in the cost of a room by now. I found the $10 internet fee per each 24 hours to be offensive. Also there were bottles of Aquafina in the room, but they were $4 each! I get free wi-fi and water at a Holiday Inn Express I should certainly get it in a luxurious place like this. That said, I highly recommend this hotel. I had friends at places nearby the convention center with similar cost and a much lesser hotel. This place is incredible and should be considered highly for your Seattle downtown needs. Photos to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Green is Great!”
Reviews.Author: cbwright
Reviews.Content: A LEED certified hotel with modern luxury to boot. This was a fabulous stay from start to finish. Hip bar and restaurant, large rooms with contemporary feel, wonderful spa services with friendly staff, access to pool, steam room, sauna for all guests, and delicious sustainable food menu. You must try to yogurt parfait at the coffee bar- with fresh yogurt made on premises. Would definitely stay there again or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Low water pressure”
Reviews.Author: BusterCT1K
Reviews.Content: The hotel tries to be "green" but it doesn't seem very well done. The "green" faucets means water pressure from the taps and in the shower were too low for my liking. For all the money one is paying for a four-star hotel, one should be able to get good, strong water pressure. It's not like Seattle is in a desert or a drought zone! The Pacific Northwest is one of the wettest, rainiest, and most verdant places in the country, and suffers from no shortage of water. "Green" also means the elevators are very slow. You can wait a long time for one and the slow ride suggests a lack of sense of urgency. Not business friendly. On the plus side, the rooms (especially the luxury suites) were very clean and spacious. Diamond breakfast amenity is a free entree and a free drink (juice OR coffee - not both) and you need to present a voucher that the front desk might or might not remember to give you. Beds very comfortable and room was mostly quiet, except for one day when I could hear conversation through the airvent from the room above (or below) mine. The valet service is very good. My car was always available when I called in advance for it. There is street parking in the blocks around the hotel (mostly west and north), but that part of the Seattle gets a bit sketchy and parking rules are a bit arcane, so I wouldn't recommend it for a first-time visitor. There is also a pay lot across the street that seems slightly cheaper than the valet. Internet is supposed to be free for diamond and platinum members but be alert to additional charges - Tmobile often throws extra charges onto the bill. I would certainly consider coming back. Hopefully the water pressure gets improved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: david_tanya
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Olive 8 for a business trip to Seattle. Fortunately, we were able to book the hotel at a government rate of $159/night. But, when we were looking into booking, regular prices were in the $300 range - the hotel is definitely not worth that price tag. The hotel was very nice – clean, modern and trendy. It is close to the main Seattle attractions. My main complaint – and I believe it is a complaint that has been raised by others – is that the “extras” can get very expensive. Valet parking is $40/day and wireless is also extra ($10-$15 if I recall correctly). They have one free computer in the lobby right next to the concierge, which makes it very awkward for anything other than a quick look-up of anything. We paid extra for the wireless in the room and it worked one night, but not the next. The front desk clerk said there had never been any complaints about internet in the rooms and that we should contact T-Mobile to get it sorted out (as if!). When I mentioned the problem again in the morning to a different clerk, she said that there are always complaints about their internet and that it’s spotty. It’s not a big deal, but I really didn’t like the fact that the first person was somewhat disingenuous about the whole situation. Overall, there’s nothing wrong with the hotel and you should definitely go ahead and book it if you get a great rate. But, again, I’d think twice about booking this at regular retail rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Campbell09
Reviews.Content: My husband was running the Seattle Rock and Roll marathon and we were looking for a clean hotel that was closed to the finish line. There was free underground downtown transit across the street from this hotel and it made it very convenient to get back to hotel to clean up after the race. My 10 year old and 6 year old loved this hotel, especially the huge pool. This hotel is attentive to fine details. There is even music speakers under the water while you swim! The beds were super comfy and location is close to everything. My only complaint was there were no kids channel on the TV. We had to order pay TV to see a kids movie to keep them entertained at night. We would love to come back next year for the marathon :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Easystreet
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in the very spacious Preium 2 bedroom. Staff is great, very polite and helpful. Room is very clean and comfy. Nicely furnished with quality modern furn. Good location for restuarants and walking. Very nice spa Cons: Room service messed up our orders on two ocassions but quickly corrected them. VERY sueeky bathroom door. Thats' all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Olive 8”
Reviews.Author: birthdaygirl925
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying at Olive 8 for a night before leaving for an Alaskan cruise. My husband, seventeen year old son, and I loved it! The location is great for walking in the city and to the waterfront, the hotel was swanky yet quiet, the bed was comfy, the fitness center was awesome, and the concierge and bellman really went out of their way to help us. I can't think of a single negative! Next time we're in Seattle we'll definitely stay here again! Thumbs up all the way around...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nilssons
Reviews.Content: We booked a family package at the Hyatt At Olive 8 for 244 USD, in which a Premier Queen Room, breakfast for the whole family (two adults and up to four kids) and a kids snack upon arrival was included. My family and I arrived around 11.00 a.m. and the hotel let us check in early. We had to remind them about the Kids snack (it might be due to our early arrival) but the staff member was really nice about it and cookies and Vanilla milk was delivered to our room shortly. We had a large, clean and very nice corner room with views over the city. Our kids (2 and 5 yrs old) enjoyed the The Pool facilities very much. The breakfast was very good but what was included in the rate was a bit fuzzy. When we first arrived at the hotel I asked the concierge about how the breakfast was arranged. He just told me to tell the restaurant that it was included in our rate. Then when we arrived there in the morning we asked the person greeting us the same question and she told us to ask our server. Our server then told us it was only a main course per adult that was included and that the children's meals would come on a separate bill, even though we said we had a family package. We ordered and she left. When we got the bill we asked again, as we were pretty sure the kid's meals were supposed to be included as well. She then tried to call the reception, but couldn't get hold of them, and told us to solve it at check-out. When we got back to our room we checked our reservation form, which said breakfast from the kid's menu was included up to four children. As we didn't know this, we had ordered from the regular menu for one of our boys. When we checked out we told the concierge about this and we didn't have to pay for any of the breakfast. So, everything was solved in a good way, I just wish that it wouldn't have caused all that confusion. Other than that we are very pleased with our stay at Hyatt At Olive and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: beargo
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel in Seattle in a room at the 12th floor. Our room was rather large, nicely designed and the bed was large and comfortable. The service was friendly and we where able to check-in earlier than usual. The location is excellent: just a few minutes walk from pike place market and it's near restaurants, the monorail and other downtown places. The bathing room was large and included a walk0in shower (no bath). The internet was not free and costs an additional $10 per day. Bottom line: Great hotel, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: mwalno
Reviews.Content: What GREAT service. I arrived before noon, and Stephen Bremish was at the front counter and said "I love taking care of Diamond Members"....best greeting I have EVER received!!!! The Portland Hyatt Place - http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/2010/04/hyatt-place-portland-or-april-21.html - could learn a lot from the level of service provided here. Please see my blog at http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/ My room was not ready, but I did not really care, and when I returned that evening it was. The room set-up is kind of strange, I am not much "into" the modern look and feel in properties....but they have a great bed and the room is QUIET. It is not great to work in, and the Internet connection is just ok. The guys who park the car are very nice, efficient (car is there when you ask), and good with directions. The restaurant, Urbane, is great for breakfast! Service is exceptional, and I would stay here again for sure! Package (room) 179.55 Valet Parking 33.00 Tax 33.52 Total - $491.82 (2 nights)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: goldie7111
Reviews.Content: Great experience. The staff was wonderful. Valet quick, bar decent, location great, room nice and quiet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: LovinNYC2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night - saw Russell Peters at the Paramount Theatre. A fantastic location for us. Close to everything...restaurants, shopping and it was literally a hop, skip and a jump to the theatre. The hotel was very good overall. Having stayed at other 4-5 star hotels, I found the staff at the front desk to be professional, courteous, efficient but not overly friendly or welcoming. But, that was no big deal. My one major complaint is that the drapes in the room do not go all the way to the floor, so once the sun came up, I did too! So, if u're looking for a place to sleep in, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: sojourner2000
Reviews.Content: The Olive 8 Hyatt was outstanding in every way--check in and out procedures, room accommodations, helpful staff, and excellent restaurant. My family and I arrived at 10:30 a.m. and the hotel let us check in early! The rooms were spacious and had state of the art computer connections. They also have an open computer at the concierge desk for quick Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights with grandson beginning of June, I asked at check in if breakfast was included and I was told it was. So first morning breakfast would have cost 62usd. I was later checking account on TV and saw some charges for restaurant. When I asked reception about this I was told the room only included a 20usd allowance towards breakfast which was not explained during check in. The wireless internet is not great. You have to sign in to T-Mobile and it only allows one computer to log in at a time. Room was not very clean, Frosted glass on bathroom door was filthy, something spilled on it and covered in handprints. Coffee table was also not clean when we arrived. Location was great, within walking distance to most things. Room was quite noisy. There is a alley down back of hotel with lots of noise from garbage cans. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The location cannot be beat close to Pacific Place Mall, short walk to Pike Place Market. Rooms are clean and modern and staff remembers your name and greets you when you come and go. My rate included breakfast which was outstanding..... usually included breakfast is a couple of stale rolls and maybe some canned fruit BUT at Hyatt Olive 8 I was able to choose anything from the menu. A lot of free range and organic options to choose from. The SPA/Pool facilities are top notch. I highly recommend this property to anyone. If flying into SEATAC take the light rail all the way to the last stop and walk a couple of blocks- $2.50 and not worth paying a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MIAnonymous
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site were right on as usual! Stayed here for about a week while I attended a conference. The hotel's location was perfect, with a very short walk to the convention center and an easy stroll down to the Pike Place market area. Plenty of restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk, and the hotel's restaurant and room service were also quite good. All of the staff members were very nice and everything in the guest room was new, comfortable, and scrupulously clean. Highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: dofter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with my parents in one room(!) and still managed to have a good time. Beds are super comfy, location is good and everything is very clean. Had to ask twice about extra towels though. Layout of room not the best for 4 adults but we managed. Parking is expensive but downtown Seattle always is. Valet was efficient. Breakfast was good if a bit expensive but no more than I'd expect for downtown Seattle. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kimboclay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Hyatt at Oive 8 and it was a wonderful place to stay! The hotel is beautiful -- modern, understated, great decor. The room, with 2 queen sized beds, was big enough for 2 women with 2 large suitcases and all the cosmetics and accessories -- not to mention all the bags we brought back after a day or 2 of hitting up just about every retail establishment and doing our part to help Seattle's economy. The conceriege was terrific -- he gave us 3 recommendations for restaurants and each was better than the last. Fabulous dinners! The on site restaurant was also lovely -- great breakfast (which was included in our AAA room rate -- an outstanding deal!) and wonderful service. Our only complaint -- housekeeping was the weakest link. We returned at 4:30 on our first day out, tired from walking and shopping, and the housekeepers had just arrived. They then rushed through their duties, handing me a roll of toilet paper as they left the room. The robe my friend wore was left on a chair, toiletries were not replaced...nothing that was terrible but just not done as I'm sure management would want. On our second day, as we left the hotel in the morning, we requested that the room be cleaned before 4 p.m. It was. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel and would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: 1WagMore-BarkLess
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I took Trip Advisor's advice. I walked past a couple other Seattle hotels that I had considered and I am so glad I chose the Hyatt Olive 8. The location was wonderful and I felt safe staying by myself. I stayed for 2 nights, left for 2 nights and returned for 1 night. The first room was a King room and I preferred it over the King corner room. I had an early flight and the King corner room had two walls of windows which let in light and sound even with heavy drapes. The rooms were spotless ! The taupe, beige, and black decor was very contemporary and the bathrooms featured dual flush toilets. You have to put your keycard in an electrical receptacle by the door so that the electricity works. After removing the card, the lights go out in 20 seconds. Very green! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHBingham
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 is really a great hotel. The green focus is really nice and it doesn't change how comfortable the hotel is. Additionally, the hotel is just two block from the Washington State Convention Center and the shopping district. The Hyatt is a really great addition to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaWindyCity
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Seattle for a long weekend and stayed at this hotel. It is a really nice hotel, very modern with comfortable, spacious rooms. It is in the downtown area of the city, about 15 minutes walk to Pike Place Market. The swimming pool/gym area is also very spacious and kept very clean. The only complaint is that the walls in the bathroom are paper thin...we could hear a full conversation our neighbours were having! It didn't seem to be a problem in the bedroom though! I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Olive”
Reviews.Author: Scottd237
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Olive. After 26 Hours traveling from Australia I was greeted warmly and the staff were friendly and helpfull. I have eaten at the Restaurant in house and whilst the service was a little sketchy, the food was fine although an odd wine list. The room has been very comfortable, the bed a notable asset to the room. Toiletries, shower and bathroom facilities excellent. Internet access is nice and fast and easy to access. The pool/spa was excellent and after a long trip it was fantastic. I wandered around downtown and olive 8 was well located for those who like to walk around a city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely spa”
Reviews.Author: ellysiab
Reviews.Content: My girls and I stayed there while we were visiting Seattle to tour the UW. We were able to walk everywhere in the city (except to the UW). The room was nice. I really liked the comfortable furinishings and the bathroom was very well appointed with nice products and decor. The pool was very nice...salt water. My only complaint was that we had noisy neighbors with small children, but that cannot be helped. Also, the elevator call tone was loud enough for me to hear it in my room, so next time I will request a room further away from the elevator. I still give it five perfect stars because it really was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay in seattle”
Reviews.Author: WithLove71
Reviews.Content: the mandatory valet fee is a little pricey , but then again parking gets expensive everywhere in downtown Seattle... I find it ridiculous for a hotel like the Hyatt not to offer free Internet and to see other cheaper hotels or motels offering it to their guests... I'm still puzzled by it, considering the price paid for the stay. The gym was great, friendly staff, the spa area is outstanding, our room had great views, late check-out .. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: wkbrant
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded us of the more "Western" hotels of Japan. The Concierge service before my arrival arranging a special birthday and welcome home from my husband that was deployed was fantastic with accommodations, restaurant reservations, checking on transportation. Just perfect. The wine and Fran's chocolates int he room were a fabulous surprise. The Spa was great, I made arrangements for my husband to have services for a gift while taking the kids to the pool - big treat in WA winter! We think the Olive 8 is a great location for the Theaters! Can't wait to go back - the Military Discount made it an affordable splurge Weekend! Even recommended it to friends who decided to join us that weekend and have been back since!!! Only disappointments: 1)Contract valet service clipped a wall or pole with our truck significantly damaging the driver mirror and nothing was said. We were given our keys and truck when it was brought up and when getting in it was noticed right away. The wall (stucco/cement/paint) was still very visible and there was no way you could have not realized you did it and the mirror itself was hanging out!. We had to wait about an additional 45 minutes to depart (with 2 young kids) while they tried to sort it out and get claim forms and try to find duct tape so we could see to drive as changing lanes in Seattle is very difficult without mirrors. No one from the hotel made a move to see what the problem was, when I went in to take a child to the restroom - I mentioned it to the front desk and they seemed unmoved. In the end we did get a check to cover the exact amount of damages after providing then with 2 estimates from 2 different repair shops. 2) Spa staff gave my husband his receipt for the services that I had arranged to be billed to our room and asked NOT to provide him with any receipt or bill! Not a huge deal, but I did not want him to worry about how much it cost after he was relaxed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another 5 star stay in Seattle at the Hyatt at Olive 8!”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaTraveler52
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my third trip to Seattle in 18 months and my third stay at the Hyatt at Olive 8. As always, they did not disappoint! The new light rail from Sea Tac airport cost only $2.50 and put me a short 2-1/2 blocks from the hotel, which was an easy walk in a nice part of the city. Check-in was quick and smooth and I received two upgrades which I had signed up for on-line in advance - a corner room on a high floor for only $28 extra per night which was a very good deal! My room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. There was a very busy international conference of some sort in the hotel and the third floor was hopping with meetings and attendees. But my room was peaceful and quiet at all hours and I couldn't have felt more relaxed when I was there. The restaurant served a great dinner and breakfast as usual. And I always like to treat myself at the Elaia Spa with a massage or some other treatment. I enjoy the spa and the facilities, especially their wonderful steam room - so relaxing!!! Next time I have to come to Seattle I will be sure to stay there again. Thank you Hyatt at Olive 8 for another wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: MegsMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February and March on 2 seperate occasions and I can highly recoomend this hotel. We travelled with our little girl and the staff were very helpful. We stayed in a suite and upon return were upgraded which was wonderful as it gave room for our little girl to move around. I booked and prepaid for our accomadation and was billed again prior to check out but this was fixed very quickly when I made the staff aware of this, and the staff delt with this very quickly and professionally - Alan at the reception/porter was also very helpful and the staff at this hotel are a credit to this Hyatt. The location is fantastic and just down the road from the markets and Nordstrom and Maceys if you want to do some shopping. It is also very close to the monorail. We visit Seattle every 2 years and have found our home away from home. Thank you for a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “A new SEA favorite.”
Reviews.Author: phl-kc
Reviews.Content: As a SPG Platinum, I usually stay at the W or Westin. Both were sold-out so I tried the Hyatt at Olive 8. I'm really pleased with the choice. The hotel worked very nicely for me. Liked the fitness center, urbane bar, the location, the room (my room was two queen beds) and comfort of the bed. No real perks or upgrades since I only stay at Hyatts 5-10 times per year versus 30+ at Starwood. I imagine if you are Diamond or Platinum, that would address a few of the minor things that annoyed me like no rgreeting at check-in and not providing complementary bottled water. Overall, I was really pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Olive 8!”
Reviews.Author: cindysass
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fantastic 6 night stay at the Hyatt Olive 8. The hotel is stylish and modern from top to bottom! From the room, to the service, to the delicious (AND CHEAP) happy hour menu in the lobby bar, our stay couldn’t have been better! We did an “e-Stand by” upgrade from a deluxe to a superior queen/queen room and got it! It was an enormous corner room; I would recommend booking this room as it was approx 300sf larger than the deluxe rooms. Another plus was that it had a long entrance hall which made disturbance from hallway noise impossible. I have to say I’m a little confused by some of the reviews here. Coming from California, I was already familiar with low flow shower heads which have been code here for years. The water saving flush feature on the toilet (as one guest complained) could have been quickly fixed by holding down the flush button! The most perplexing of the reviews was how someone felt they might have been treated better at the Holiday Inn. Let’s not compare apples with oranges here people! A traveler who enjoys the value of a Holiday Inn wouldn’t appreciated the advantages of staying in a smoke-free, LEED certified hotel like the Olive 8. Likewise the traveler who felt the service would have been better if they had stayed at Hotel 1000 or the Four Seasons, at $100-200 more a night, I would certainly hope so! Last but not least, if you find you’re not getting the quality or service you expected out of your stay, don’t wait until you’re checking out to complain! If you give the management the opportunity to correct any problems, while they still can, you’ll be a lot happier! I find quite a few reviewers on Trip Advisor seem to have very high, sometimes unrealistic, standards. As a travel agent, I too have high standards and I would have no problem recommending the Hyatt Olive 8 to any of my clients!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and terrific accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: whatscookintonight
Reviews.Content: We were WOW'ed by the excellent service at the Olive 8! The staff were very friendly and became part of the family by the end of our stay. Kudos to Scott! We stayed with our 16 year old and his friend during the Sakuracon. The Convention hotels were all filled up by the time we were selecting a place to stay - and we were lucky that happened - giving us a chance to try the Hyatt at Olive 8! The hotel is a block north of the convention, just perfect. My wife and I are very experienced hotel travellers. The room was very clean and nicely decorated with a nice desk equipped with all of the internet and power plugins anyone would need. The beds were good but not luxurious soft. I used the awesome workout gym and pool, and utilized the first class locker room. I wish patrons could use the lockers with their own lock or check out of a key from the spa. My wife had a hot stone massage at the spa which was excellent. The overall experience at Olive 8 was terrific. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Olive 8 or Homeless Hangout at Olive 8?”
Reviews.Author: runtoregon
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff keeps eyes down and does not greet anyone coming through the front sliding glass doors. As we relaxed in lobby chairs each afternoon, we watched a homeless man enter the building, go to the lobby bathrooms to use for shaving and other activities for 30-45 minutes with no interventions by security or front office...probably because all of their eyes are down or they are busy talking to one another instead of greeting the guests or watching who comes in and out of hotel. The restaurant, Urbane, was fabulous with great food and service. The coffee bar staff was pleasant and they make an excellent coffee to accompany homemade bakery items from Urbane. I recommend UMI and WILD GINGER in Seattle, along with Urbane in the hotel! Location of hotel is great...a nice walk to restaurants and Pike Market. The Spa is nice, but confusing on use of spa services vs. pool/locker area/steam room....so many kids running around crazy that is was difficult to relax. PLUS, we were suppose to have an early check in, but no room available. They took our phone number and stored our bags and assured us they would call....no phone call for 4 hours and when we arrived back at hotel after shopping...they had dropped they ball and the new "eyes down" front desk staff knew nothing about us????? OH BOY...Next time we will stay at one of the boutique hotels like Alexis or Hotel 1000, possibly even Four Seasons on the water...BUT probably not Hyatt at Olive 8. We would go back for coffee, Urbane...but, what a nice, expensive shelter for the homeless..thanks Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: rwgav8
Reviews.Content: The "Balance Package" offered by Hyatt was the perfect combination of room/spa/parking for our anniversary weekend. I couldn't be any more pleased our selection of the Hyatt at Oive 8. We selected a corner king and it was quite roomy with a great view out of the huge windows. The location was perfect and within walking distance of the heart of the shopping district. The staff was extremely kind, professional, and service oriented. We look forward to staying at Olive 8 in the future. Thank you for helping to make our anniversary weeekend a success!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Halfwhit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Hyatt at Olive 8 in February of 2010. Nice and new decor. The room was super comfortable and beautuful. I loved the sliding door to the bathroom and the closet. The bar food was very tasty and the breakfast the next morning was great. Somewhat pricey of a place to stay, based on the price for the valet parking and the food, will probably stay elsewhere next time, but if price is of no concern to you then this place is for you. Within walking distance of lots of shopping, cafes, coffee shops and sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: jhnh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 6 nights at the Hyatt Olive 8 and we loved it. The location was perfect with great shopping and restaurants close by. Our king room was nicely decorated , spacious and very comfortable. Loved the 37" flat screen tv. The staff were very friendlly and helpful. Give this hotel a try and we think that you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe my new favorite place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Bad-Horse
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle frequently on business and have stayed at many of the downtown properties -- the Westin, the Sheraton, the Hilton, the Crowne Plaza, both Kimpton properties, etc. But I may have just found a new favorite hotel in downtown Seattle, the Hyatt at Olive 8. The decor is elegant and calm. The room was spacious and well-appointed. I particularly like the oversized sliding wood-and-frosted-glass doors on the closet and the shower, which give the room a more upscale feel compared to regular doors. The glass-walled walk-in shower was a nice plus, though I personally would have designed it with dual shower heads. The bed was comfortable and the wireless Internet service, while not free, was fast and reliable. Service at the hotel was excellent. Wake up calls are made by humans rather than machines and come with an optional 10-minute followup call. One morning I accidentally left the phone off the hook after the first call, and the hotel sent someone to knock on my door and make sure I was awake. Now that's customer service. The gym is spotless and outfitted with plenty of quality equipment including treadmills, ellipticals, stationary bikes, and a complete set of weight stations. The pieces of aerobic equipment all have individual television screens, of course. The Hyatt hotels with condos attached are often known for the quality of their gyms, and this one is no exception. If it just had the stunning view of the fitness center at the Sheraton, it would be perfect. But it was close enough. For swimmers there's a 65 foot saline lap pool, which was a real treat and something I haven't found at any other downtown property. And there's a complete day spa on the property, which I did not get to sample this trip. Breakfast at the Urbane was good (my waiter the first morning spoiled me by bringing steamed milk for the coffee), though I'd still trek over to Toulouse Petite on Queen Anne for their pain perdu if I had time. The only thing that marred my stay at the Hyatt at Olive 8 was a very loud bunch of kids partying in the room next door until the wee hours of the morning. They were loud enough, and the walls thin enough, that I could hear every word. At 1:30 am I finally called down to the front desk. They offered to send hotel security up to quiet the party down, but it took them a good half hour to get someone on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Selection!”
Reviews.Author: Kerfew23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and the customer service is something for other hotels to aspire to. The king room was spacious, eco-friendly, and clean. My only complaints (minor) are that the walls are quite thin, and you can hear other guests through the bathroom vents. In addition, there's no vent in the bathroom and the elevator is a touch slow once in motion. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends. The hotel is the one thing that I didn't need to worry about while in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: evatique
Reviews.Content: From the food to the bed, the place is amazing! Wonderful massage by Brian, nice spa. Green, fresh, new!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL with a GREAT SPA!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This is a new GREAT hotel in a downtown Seattle. The location is close to Pike Place market, Space Needle and the downtown mall. The hotel is beautiful and has an outstanding spa! I love the Hotel 1000, the Four Seasons and now I have a third hotel in Seattle the Hyatt at Olive 8.

Reviews.Title: “Olive 8 is worth considering for your trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: calilady32
Reviews.Content: I've visited Seattle on business at least 25-30 times in the past and stayed in various hotels. This and one other hotel outside of Seattle called Hotel Woodmark in Carrolin Point have so far been my favorite. This time I went with my husband and baby with a group of people for an award trip and they really made our stay comfertable. They delivered my baby's crib with cute little toiletries for her. We stayed in a corner room so I cant say we expreinced the noise that the other people did. I really liked the concept of the key switch controlled by the card because many times I forget to turn off the lights when leaving a room. I also liked the shower without the door however I found the shower head and the pressure of the water rather annoying. Since we had a corner room we were looking right into someone's office and since it was over the weekend it wasnt a big deal. I would def stay here again because it is a beautiful hotel with great service and you cannot beat the location. It is walking distance to great shopping, Pikes Place and so close to so many attractions in Seattle. I wouldnt reccomend eating at the restaurant as we thought the food was less than average there. Seattle has so many great restaurants I would get out and try them instead of eating there. Also the parking is really expensive and the charge for internet access is too high.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite downtown Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: naotmordechai
Reviews.Content: I travel to downtown Seattle on business more than a dozen times a year. I recently stayed at this Hyatt and loved it. The corner room was spacious with almost too many windows (is that possible?), the room was quiet, and the staff helpful. I particularly loved the pool. As a business traveler, it was easy to grab a light breakfast in the lobby on my way out. The downtown area at night can be a little scary but safe enough. I feel safer if I avoid Pine and Pike since that's where panhandlers and others tend to hang out. But even though streets are ok.
