If this Hyatt was less expensive I'd choose it over my usual choices of the nearby Sheraton and Fairmont hotels (both very fine properties in their own right) since it suits my particular needs so well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, if you wish downtown location”
Reviews.Author: westonct1998
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and service. Reasonably priced. Only reservation would be downtown Seattle is not particularly nice at night - very seedy. Would consider staying across the lake in Kirkland and commuting into Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: whiterump
Reviews.Content: The service and cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. Close to bus routes, which are free in downtown Seattle. Being a 'green' hotel it took some time getting used to placing my key card in a 'powerbox' to work the lighting in the room. The shower water trickles out, again 'green'. The toilet also has a 'poo' button and 'pee' button, again very 'green' The pool and hot tub area is very clean and well taken care of. The restroom leading to the pool area has a steam room a dry heat room and the showers are to die for. Complimentary mouth wash, combs, razors, shaving cream, tooth paste, blow dryer etc.. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta-Travelin
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, it was exciting to see the outside and lobby..located on the corner of 8th and Olive, it's in a good spot. Great vibe and lively upon entrance. The room was a good size and seeing a shower in a Hyatt was a nice treat (although the water pressure was lame). Once you fall asleep you are awaken by the sound of doors slamming and can hear everything in the room next door. We stayed 2 nights and it happened both nights. Many of the reviews indicated this noise and they are true. You will wake up tired and annoyed! The restaurant Urbane is cool and the food was ok...had better. The little cafe in the hotel has amazing ham & cheese biscuits and homemade yogurt ...don't miss out on this if you do stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wow...except for a few things”
Reviews.Author: drowsey
Reviews.Content: My boss booked this hotel specifically because of the good business traveller amenities, eg free bottled water, free internet, free breakfast, free newspaper, of which I got none and ended up paying extra. I voiced my disappointment to reception on check-out and all she could say was, "Sorry" - that's it. Other than that, everything was absolutely perfect - the staff, the room, the location - just perfect, flawless. I really wanted to give them 5 stars but for that slip-up.

Reviews.Title: “brand new hotel fabulous gym and pool”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on hyatt.com for a premier double queen room using AAA. Attended conference at Hyatt grand, my rate at the olive 8 was lower than the conference rate across the street. Room was HUGE. With two queen beds, two chairs, a desk, a table, a tv console, and an extra end seat, the room still seemed sparsely furnished. You could get serious exercise just walking across the room and back. Fitness ctr and pool are lovely - like a health club rather than hotel. Pool is lap pool maybe 20 yards? Room had 1 terry robe for two people - not sure why there were not two robes. Wifi did not work well with my mac - the desk guy said the same thing about his mac. Had to switch to wired ethernet which was fine. Around $10/day. Had to ask to have wifi charge removed because they double billed me for internet. They fixed it without a fuss. Tmobile is the wifi carrier and they seem to have a problem with macintosh hardware in general. Room was reasonably quiet given the city environs. Windows not operable. Room still has a bit of the new carpet smell from the construction but not overpowering. Room service was fine. Parking is expensive around $36/day with tax for valet. Service however was excellent. Staff was very helpful. Hyatt uses overly smelly hair/soap products in room - did not like. However the locker rooms for the pool/gym have better products which I took back to my room in the little cups they had out for the mouthwash. In room coffee is lame - Hyatt should switch to whatever Hilton is using because it is better stuff. Did not even have real milk/creamer for coffee just powder. This is not the best western so they could do a little better with that. No coffee shop in hotel but there is a starbucks at the hyatt grand and other places nearby. No gift shop in the hotel and no vending machines but there is a convenience store 1/2 block away next to the subway. These things were minor compared to the absolutely HUGE and fantastic room we got.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: FintanMacLamhras
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend trip with a friend. Stayed in probably the largest hotel room I have ever experienced. Very modern and comfortable hotel, great workspaces. Staff were friendly and attentive. All in all I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “OMG Awesome”
Reviews.Author: callistamorgan
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel b/c i had stayed at the grand hyatt nearby last time i was in town and wanted to try another hotel (not that i didn't love the grand hyatt :)) we arrived at the hotel friday afternoon around four o'clock from seatac (we were an hour late) and our dinner guests had just arrived. the staff of the hotel were so helpful and understanding (thanks ashly). i was able to check-in easily and we were taken upstairs by todd, the bellhop (thanks to you too). the room was awesome (double beds, seating area, tv, work desk with four outlets). the sliding doors for the closet and bathroom were a plus (though the bathroom one would open on its own if you didn't shut it completely). i did experience the loud closing doors and the loud people in the hall discussed earlier (also it was always 3 in the morning and i woke up). another suggestion would be to put an extra hook or bench in the bathroom (some place else to put clothes when hook in use) and another luggage rack (i had to use the bench beside the bed and the bed to get items out of two pieces of luggage) there was a blank area on the wall between the tv and the closet that could be used for artwork and the other luggage rack. i used the pool saturday and it was great (sat in the sun and read for a few hours) checkout was a breeze and was able to print out my boarding passes from the conceirge's laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: HappyGuestWashington
Reviews.Content: If you like to be treated well and have an amazing stay in Seattle, stay at the Hyatt Olive 8. Easy check in and out. Very accomadating to your needs, pretty much have it your way and they are very cheerful about helping you out. From the ticket desk to the concierge services..never been disappointed yet!!! Great staff and management!!

Reviews.Title: “pretty dang sweet”
Reviews.Author: luimend
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very accessible, clean, staff was very helpful. Only down fall, the pillows were not as comfortable as expected and the doors shut really loud so if you are a light sleeper I wouldn’t recommend.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER LOVED THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: cubangem
Reviews.Content: This was probably the best Hotel we've ever stayed at. We also had a AAA special that included breakfast and WOW, what a breakfast!!!! The restaurant is excellent and the ambiance couldn't be better. Location is magnificent and our price couldn't be beat. To me this was a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but beware the parking charge”
Reviews.Author: Crossmichael
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt while attending the NorthWest Garden Show at the Washington State Convention Centre, which is only two short blocks away . As one would expect, the room was excellent as was the service. The one item on the bill that we found to be a bit over the top was the $39 cost for parking. I realise that parking in downtown Seattle anywhere is not cheap and that the $39 included over $6 in taxes, but still found this a bit excessive. It appears to be a growing trend in hotels to keep their room rates competitive but to recoup some of their costs with parking charges. On the plus side, we came in late in the evening and requested food that was not on the menu in the resturant and the staff not only prepared it at a reasonable price, but it was really good. Kudos to the staff. I certainly would give this hotel an excellent rating, just be aware of the cost of the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmcgregor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and overall it was a great hotel. Friendly staff, clean spacious modern rooms and a nice happy hour in the hotel bar. They have a great pool and hot tub and a well equipped mens/ladies locker room full of extra amenities. They alson have a unbelievable fitness center with state of the art equipment, fresh towls, and water. Hotel is within walking distance to great shopping and restaurants and pike place is a 10-15 min walk away. I highly recommend this hotel and give it a full 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “What Can I say but WOW”
Reviews.Author: Plawmilwaukee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Olive 8 and neither of us had been to Seattle before. This hotel is centrally located and you can walk almost everywhere. We had a package in which breakfast was included every morning and Urbane's breakfast was awesome! The staff was always very friendly and the rooms are very clean and modern. Overall one of the better hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: MainVancouver
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to Seattle. I stayed with a group of 10 girlfriends at the Hyatt Olive 8 for 3 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was the most amazing stay. The hotel was very, very nice. The hotel staff was incredible professional, helpful and super friendly. From the moment we checked in till the moment we checked out, we got the "Super Star" treatment. We enjoyed our beautiful, clean and well decorated rooms, the amazing spa facilities (we had lots of treatments) and excellent restaurant. The service was top notch where ever we went. This turned out to be the very best Girls trip we have done so far. We have been to several cities, staying at nice luxurious 5 star hotels, but our stay at this hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “This place makes me want a condo downtown with all the service”
Reviews.Author: comfortoverspeed
Reviews.Content: Young/new staff but act seasoned and calm. the room was more than enough for 4/8 year olds and parents. The location is great. 1 block from the bus tunnel and central to downtown and capital hill. Great pool and hot tub with all the little touches - hope they can keep it up. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: sdamiani
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 is what I consider the perfect hotel for both business and pleasure. It's new, in great condition, centrally located, has an awesome gym / pool and the concierge staff (especially Alex) will go out of their way to make your stay pleasurable. Many thanks and I will certainly come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “High Class Relaxation with Amazing Food!”
Reviews.Author: SATX10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get away and relax so we picked Hyatt at Olive 8 in Seattle and absolutely fell in love with it! Not only was the hotel beautiful, every single staff member we came across was friendly and accomidating. Urbane, which is the restaurant had amazing food, great atmosphere and reminded us of New York. All I have to say is... get the pork shank for dinner!! We also had a day at Elaia the day spa at the hotel and that was amazing as well. We've already told our friends that live in Seattle about it. We had an amazing stay! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with great location and extremely nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: Kathle
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel with pleasant. It is very clean. The staff is helpful and friendly. The room (a basic king) was roomy and attractive. The pool/ exercise areas are extremely nice. It is within easy walking distance to Pike's Market, Pacific Place and the downtown shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Modern gem in Seattle...”
Reviews.Author: SiLondon
Reviews.Content: Had a great few days in Seattle after a week camping in Alsaka, on our honeymoon. Admittedly any bed would have been well received after a week in a sleeping bag, but the rooms at Olive 8 were great, the service fantastic (the concierge sent us up a bottle of wine when he found out it was our honeymoon) and the earlybird price (via Hyatt's website) was reasonable too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is better than advertised...”
Reviews.Author: Opiddy
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel. Service is only a 3 because we really didn't need any. From the time you check in to the time you leave, you don't have to interact with anyone. It's all automated. Good ? I am not so sure, but our stay was just what we wanted. Quiet, convenient, efficient, and a fabulous location. Quiet? on New Year's Eve, you bet. At least we didn't hear the partying. It was great. From the two person shower to the HD TV, the room was just wonderful. Pool, Spa, Sauna, Steam room, this hotel truly was a pleasant experience. We'll be back. If saving the environment is this easy... why aren't we all doing it ???

Reviews.Title: “Bigger IS Better!”
Reviews.Author: jriceseattle
Reviews.Content: We live in Seattle and decided to book a room here for my dad for his Christmas visit. My 2 young girls were very excited that they could use the pool. My husband and I enjoyed an amazing dinner at Urbane, the hotel restaurant. We were SHOCKED to see how HUGE my dad's room was. It was a corner room on the 11th floor with city views out 2 windows. Not a breathtaking view...but extremely cool and hip. And so much space! The room service menu for the kids was great --who knew they could get so excited about chicken nuggets & mac & cheese! And my dad said he had to DRAG them out of the heated pool. I relaxed the minute I walked into the lobby. And the fantastic bar menu helped me relax even more. If you're there at the holidays I recommend the Pointsetta & the Woodsman Sour. I hope they decide to make those drinks permanent additions. The food at Urbane was outstanding. I highly recommend the Pork. HUGE. And ask for a bib! The gnocchi and salads were excellent. Our oysters were fantastic. And compared to other restaurants in Seattle, I consider the prices quite reasonable. If you're not hungry order 2-3 of the $4 side dishes like I did, and it's quite filling. I complemented the hostess on her dress and she told me it was her uniform! WOW. Even the uniforms are hip. I would recommend this hotel for anyone, families, weary travellers, business travellers, couples looking to "escape." Anyone and everyone. It's also a great location. People think 8th Ave is not in the "retail core" but it IS.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: gpryke
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through priceline and got a great rate. Unsure of what to expect when we booked, we were blown away and lucked out to get such a great hotel. The hotel is in the most perfect location close to shopping, bars, restaurants etc. It was only a couple of blocks of the I-5 and once we parked the car we never had to get it again. Our room as absolutely perfect - they told us we had a view of Capitol Hill but the weather was pretty poor so all we saw was the building across the street. We didn't have any problem with noise either from other guests or the street. Housekeeping brought a crib up for us and included an extra towel (somewhat odd seeing as there is no bath, but nice touch) and a great travel kit with baby shampoo, powder, diaper cream etc and a little rubber duck (which was great for our teething baby). We did stop in at the lounge for a night cap after evening shopping and dinner, but by that time I had had a few Guiness at Kells Irish pub down the street and just had some water and my wife ordered dessert, which she said was quite nice. We had just popped down to Seattle to do a bit of last minute Christmas shopping so didn't get to spend as much time as we would have like in the hotel. Last year we stayed at the W and the Hyatt was miles above that in comfort and service. Next time we make it down we will definately be staying here again, with or without the great deal through priceline, and taking advantage of more of the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow”
Reviews.Author: skyscraper97
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, great service....I hadnt stayed at a Hyat for a while. I usually stay at the big names like Marriott, Hilton, Sheraton, etc.. This hotel has everything from a great fitness center, spa, etc.. I will for sure be back. If I could say one thing negative it would probably be the price. My company paid the bill so I got to live it up.... But then again you get what you pay for!!! you get what you pay for here. I hope all the hyatts are consistant like this one!!

Reviews.Title: “New and modern. The resteraunt was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hloback
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic! Everything was close at hand including shopping and the Paramount theater. The rooms were immaculately clean and modern. I found the staff at the hotel to be very friendly and professional. The resteraunt was the most pleasant surprise. Our waiter (Luke I think) made some recommendations which turned out to be wonderful. I kid you not... the pork shank... yum! The steak was excellent also. We followed that up with a chocolate souffle that was to die for. All around a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Totally impressed!! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: muncherama
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Olive 8 Seattle for a night. I'm truely impressed by the service of the hotel. From the front desk lady, restaurant staff, to the pastry Chef, Emily, we were being treated with highest attentiveness and kindness. The hotel design is very clean, very modern and stylish. Food at the restaurant is out of this world, especially the dessert menu. I've ordered the pumpkin ice-cream that's garnished with Marshmellow. I would have to say, this is the best-ever dessert I've ever tasted. The marshmellow is absolutely amazing. It's really the best marshmellow in the world in my opinion. I highly recommend everyone to come and try it. I'd also like to thank our server that night at the restaurant who went out of her way to hook us up with a box-load of marshmellow on our check-out. I can't wait to go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could clone this hotel in every city”
Reviews.Author: Travel222Much
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot so have a lot to compare to. I can't say enough about how clean, modern, convenient & fantastic this place is. The rooms are SO well appointed & the decor is modern & posh. The gym is incredible - new eqiupment, free weights, etc. etc. Can easily get a full workout that compares to my gym at home in a HUGE, modern space. So many times the gym is an afterthought & you're crammed into a tiny room fighting over a broken treadmill. Not here!! The service was GREAT - maybe a little over the top with the "pleasantries" to the point it was a little scripted - but I'd much rather have that than someone who acts like I'm interrupting their day by checking in. Valet service was very efficient & friendly. Ordered room service & the food was great & came in 15 minutes. I'm a little sad I stayed here actually because now nothing else compares. Considering the rate I paid & the experience I had, the value was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Marky1971
Reviews.Content: My partner and i were on a 3 week tour of the states and Seattle was the last port of call for us,we have never stayed at Hyatt before but found this hotel very good. We found the front desk very polite and helpful and also the bellboy to be very helpful and proffesional. After checking into the room,we found it to be of a nice size,and very relaxing lighting, we did however find a very peculiar smell in the bathroom,so asked to be moved,this was not a problem and we were given another room straight away. I agree with another reviewer about the sliding door issue in the bathroom,i could see this being a problem for some people.but the bathroom was very clean and very modern with great lighting again. I particularly enjoyed the foyuer area of this hotel, it had a great buzz to it,a very social place and alot happening,the main restaurant/bar was nearly always full but there is a seperate bar where very friendly bar staff serve with a smile. The concierge was also extremely helpful and polite,all in all we really enjoyed Seattle and The Hyatt At Olive 8

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better introduction to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: moonunit999
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Seattle, so we had no expectations of what the city would be like or what our stay would be like. Both were absolutely amazing! We had our room at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for five nights, and it became our home away from home. It was a great way to be introduced to a city that fast became a must-return destination. Some highlights: - They upgraded us to a corner room (I was celebrating my birthday, and that was such a nice treat!) - The location is convenient to everything, even a Whole Foods grocery a few blocks in the opposite direction from Pike Place - The styling is modern and sleek - We had a roomy, EMPTY mini-fridge! We LOVE the empty fridge and are not minibar people, so this is a huge plus, especially when walking back and forth from Pike Place all the time with yummy snacks. - The fog-free mirror was cool, just one of those little touches that remind you you're not at home The only downsides, none of which was a big deal for us but could be for someone else: - Our wireless Internet didn't work -- they did provide us with a wired connection, though - We only had one robe in the room (huh?) - The sliding door on the bathroom would be inappropriate for anyone sharing a room who was not very familiar with their roommate - There's no tub, so don't bring bubble bath. It's a step-in shower only. - Because the hotel is so new, our driver took us to the other Hyatt and tried to unload the bags despite our insisting we were at the wrong place (that's not a Hyatt issue, it's a driver issue, but be prepared to be taken to the Grand Hyatt by mistake) All in all, I was very impressed with the service, location, room, and all-around convenience of staying at this hotel. If you book through a low-cost carrier like Priceline and find out you'll be staying here, start celebrating. You hit the jackpot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mant444
Reviews.Content: At first unsure of what hotel to pick as had never been to area before and was apprehensive regarding location as we had no knowledge of the area. We found it to be a great hotel, definitely the right choice, cheaper than other comparable hotels in the area but at no cost and gave us preferential room and check in despite booking on a "discount site." Great location, right in down town, surrounded by shopping and dining, walking distance to Pike Place Market, water front and monorail. We walked to space needle but some may find it a bit of a walk, we didn't mind at all, nice walk. Very clean and modern with comfortable beds, great gym and restaurant. Some negatives, very expensive parking, more expensive than other comparable hotels in the area and they charged for internet usage, who charges for internet usage?! All things considered, if I get to Seattle again would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh new hotel w/excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler30
Reviews.Content: We had a unique experience in Seattle. We stayed two nights at the Westin just 3 blocks away, then stayed two more nights at this hotel. The difference was night at day. For starters, the staff here seems to enjoy working at this hotel vs. in a hurry and too busy for you. The rooms are nicely appointed. And the fitness center must be among the nicest of any hotel in the Pacific Northwest. (Compare it to the cramped fitness center at the Westin and you'll see what I mean.) Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: carnalismocc
Reviews.Content: My family and I have never had a bad experience at a Hyatt property. We are pretty loyal to the brand and stay at a Hyatt whenever possible, whether for business or leisure (anywhere from 5-10 times per year.) Having said that, the staff at the Hyatt at Olive 8 treated us absolutely amazing and made us feel extremely welcome...maybe even the best out of any other Hyatt we've stayed at! After getting the best possible room available at check-in, we checked out the gym and pool on the second floor (both are great!) The spa looked really nice, but it's not really our thing, so I can't comment on that. Urbane, the onsite restaurant, was the perfect spot for dinner. The service was great, the food was tasty, the portions were good, and the prices were very reasonable. They even had a good kids menu! The hotel is new and has a nice modern look, the location is perfect for walking down to Pike Place Market, or for a nice evening walk (which we took after dinner.) It'll be a no-brainer when deciding where to stay next time we're in Seattle. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: george1977
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment this Hotel was. Location was fine and intitial impression is good but the staff was incompetent on top of having a strange facility to work in. Part of the hotel floors are full time condos and the rest are normal hotel rooms. I'm not sure which were first but this hotel has the SLOWEST elevators known to mankind and the mixed use may be the reason. This was the NOISIEST Hotel we have EVER stayed in without exception. The design of the hotel puts the rooms in a culdesac arrangement that allows you to hear even normal conversation in the rooms around you. Every time someone closes their entry door in the rooms around you it sounds like your room door closing. The worst part of this stay is that they put us on a floor with what appeared to be a bachlorette party (no guys) that reserved most of the floor, even though we asked for a quiet room at check in. The noise started at 11pm, security came up and asked them to be quiet, no better. We could hear every word while the drunk girls are angrily asking who is complaining. The second time they asked the girls to leave to party and it was quiet for a couple of hours. At 3 am, after hearing a fight conversation because the girls ran out of beer, I called the desk and asked to be put on a different floor first thing in the morning. They agreed to do so. 5 minutes later a "Security" person knocks on our door to hand me a key while the drunk girls are looking at our door saying "That's the room that turned us in" , unbelievable. The next morning I went down to get a luggage cart to move to the new room (we had 2 weeks worth of stuff on our way to Victoria BC for vacation) and was told I could only use a bellman and was refused the use of a cart. I had all I could take of the staff at that point and moved the bags in two trips with my wife. The second day in the new room, staring at the office workers in the next building, was ok except for the slamming doors and hearing the couple next door make their breakfast plans for the morning. Non noise issue, all of the pillows are the same, firm. So, if you're planning a bachelor or bachlorette party, grad or prom party this is a great choice. If you looking for a relaxing quiet hotel for a weekend getaway, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stylish Hotel, Close to Everything. GREEN!”
Reviews.Author: Nevadatraveller
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel. Clean room. Good food onsite (happy hour was awesome!). Located close to everything we wanted to do in Seattle (Pikes, Space Needle, Capital Hill, Shopping). Comfortable bed. Loved the TV! Hotel turn-down service was not the best (I thought they should leave chocolates) and we tipped the cleaning staff daily but did not get better service which is one reason to tip.... Concierge's recommendation for dinner places was not good (use the internet and avoid old places to eat). They should have free WI-FI but don't....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - agreed by all”
Reviews.Author: BlackStar926
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference for 3 nights. 1) Staff were friendly, courteous, and efficient. My bill took no time at all to print out. My room service was delivered in 5 mins (it was fruit & cottage cheese). I got sick in the middle f the night and they brought me up some ginger ale. The housekeeping was immaculate. 2) The gym is first class. They have water, towels, magazines, and headphones. The place is huge. Its not a typical hotel gym. 3) The rooms were modern and the beds were comfortable. The closet and bathroom doors were on sliders. The bathroom has no tub (fine by me) and b/c its a green building, low flow shower heads. It was decent water pressure. The only bad part of the hotel, was that there was a 1/2 inch gap under the door so it let light in at night. I put a towel in front of it after the first night so I could sleep better. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great big LCD TV in nice and new rooms - check for good rates”
Reviews.Author: nilsstegemann
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel from my point of view are the 37" LCD TV's that bring HDTV to your hotel room. The rooms look new and quite clean. The location of the hotel is close to the Convention Center and downtown Seattle. The restaurant inside the hotel is extremely overpriced, but you can find everything you need close by. There is a refrigerator and an electric kettle in the room. The refrigerator did not work in my room at first, but they could fix it within a day. Service (maid service, front desk) is okay, but nothing special. For your transfer from/to the airport consider taking bus route 194 for just USD 1.75 instead of the modes the hotel want to arrange for you. Internet costs USD 9.99 per day which is acceptable (though, of course, free internet access should be the standard). I got a fair deal for this hotel at Priceline (USD 130 per night incl. taxes w/o breakfast), so try there and don't pay too much.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Style with Urbane Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: servok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. The gym is first class with modern LifeFitness equipment in a super clean gym looking outside from the 2nd floor. There are free weights as well as an adjoining room for aerobics, yoga, etc. There were at least 8 treadmills and 4 bicycle machines. The restaurant and lobby bar were extremely nice with 5 local draught beers and local cheeses and cured meats available. The staff from bellman to the receptionists were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facilities with clean, modern decor”
Reviews.Author: PortlandMichelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and within the financial district in Seattle. Not too close to downtown nightlife, but walkable to shopping and Pike's Place. The rooms were not terribly big, but well furnished and made good use of the space.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Green Hyatt in Emerald City”
Reviews.Author: Mich415
Reviews.Content: Conceived and created as a green hotel, this is one of the few LEED-certified hotels in the U.S. . And every room has a system where lights and appliances can only be used if a keycard is in a wall slot, which ensures you don’t leave anything on while you’re out. Great staff, attention to every detail.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is new and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: randikg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and so was the price! The decor was beatiful, clean and modern. The rooms were very comfortable. The pool was beautiful too. The location was central. I would highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: BeachgirlRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed this summer for convention. Stay was about a week. FABULOUS hotel. Rooms were quiet, well appointed, and good sized. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Front desk staff was friendly and concierge was very helpful.Great pool area (had one issue with parents who thought 5 kids under 8 or 9 in the jacuzzi was appropriate) and great gym area. Room service was super tasty- did not have time for restaurant. Lobby coffee bar was good, but slow. The spa is the best perk of the place. A must if you can! Great location to convention center as well as mall and a short walk to Pike Place Market.On bus route and within the free bus zone. WOULD DEFINITELY USE AGAIN AND AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderluster2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for one night. Overall, the stay was great and the location was great, within walking distance of all the downtown attractions. We got a good deal through the Hyatt website ($150 for the night). As others have mentioned, parking is quite pricey ($31 for 24 hours, with in and out privileges), but not unexpected for the downtown area. However, of larger concern, the walls seem to be quite thin (between rooms and into the hallway) and when combined with loud neighbours with a inclination for slamming doors, this was not the most enjoyable way to be awaken on a Sunday morning. But, I would stay here again, especially if the same rate was available.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Well Located”
Reviews.Author: MongolGlobal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. This hotel was walking distance to the Pike's Place Market, shopping centers & Seattle Center. The staff was all very helpful and cheerful. Pool and gym were very nice. The ammenities in the room were great. I love it when the mirrors in the bathroom don't fog up (it's the little things). Windows didn't open, but part of the look of the building I suppose. I loved the blue color it was really fun. I really enjoyed my stay there. Seattle was great. Didn't hurt that the weather was gorgeous. Great cheap bar Vons very close. $2.5 for a little beer, can't beat that...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, contemporary, and conveniently located. The staff was efficient and quite helpful. We really enjoyed our stay! And the spa was top-knotch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gocubbies1984
Reviews.Content: This was our third time coming up to the Seattle for area and once we found out the Olive 8 was LEED certified at a comparable rate as other hotels in the area our decision was made for us. This hotel is fantastic, the restaurant / bar, and coffe shop / wine bar areas were terrific. A tremendous value especially during happy hour. The workout center is by far the largest I can recall seeing. The staff was extremely helpful and informative and the downtown location is close to all the major attractions (including Qwest Field - as we were in town to see the Bears / Seahwawks game). One suggestion would be to have a public area for internet usage (besides the one by the conceirge) We would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME from the moment we walked in the door!!!”
Reviews.Author: redkeeth
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Seattle and we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We were blow away with the staff. Everyone was friendly no matter who it was. The maids even said hello and good morning. The room was great! It was so beautiful and it was the perfect way to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We stayed in a Corner King, room 747 to be exact. The wall to wall windows and the bathroom were to die for. We had a view of the green roof and the Paramont Theater. We had breakfast with our stay and it was no problem at checkout. So the problem that they had before has now been fixed. The hotel is within walking distance to everything. If you plan on staying in Seattle, you need to stay at Hyatt Olive 8.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, room layout odd”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olive 8 for two nights - in a corner king room. The room was nice, but the layout was such a waste of space! The 'extra' square feet was in the entrance and hallway, but NOT in the actual space where it would have been more beneficial - bigger sitting / sleeping area perhaps? Imagine the heat/air wasted in the entrance and hallway - total waste! The bathroom was ok - no shower pressure to speak of, spend three times longer to take a shower, another waste. The toilet smelled funny after use - like sewage. I don't know if I would stay here again, as booking a bigger room was just given a total waste of space for more money! The hotel staff is very good and so is the location, but I am sure better deals for same size rooms are out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great design, wonderful gym, decent service...”
Reviews.Author: mobster78
Reviews.Content: The exterior and interior of this hotel are excelllent. Very modern and minimal, yet still very inviting. The lobby and restaurant downstairs are both fantastic. The front desk staff and concierge are very good. The gym is THE best gym that I've been to in a hotel hands down. I have two negatives about this place... First, although the hotel itself is decently priced, everything else is waaaay overpriced. I ordered a simple bowl of oatmeal, a can of diet coke and a side of bacon to the room in the morning and it was $28! I ordered a Laphroig 10 year on the rocks at the bar and it was $20! Overnight parking is $33, which is bad, but to be expected I guess in the city. Second, while the service at the front desk, concierge and bar are all great, the staff at the "wine bar" leaves something to be desired. They didn't know which cheeses or meats were which and it took them like 15 minutes to slice cheese and cured meat. Picky I know, but when you pay $16 for a tiny bit of cured ham and a slice of cheese, you expect them to know what they are talking about and serve it quickly. All in all, a fantastic hotel. Don't read too much into my complaints. The rooms and hotel overall are great. I would say that they should invest a bit more in their employees to match. I'll definitely come back though... Probably again and again. Much better value than the W or similar joints.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place - I'd go back in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: meso_white
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to a Hotel Chain that is making a difference! Picked due to the LEED clasifications and some great online rates - the hotel did not disappoint. Beautiful building, great staff and some amazing amenities that would have me back in a heart beat. Starting with the exceptional customer service at both the valet and front desk, we felt immediatly welcomed and special. The building was absolutly stunning, from the blue glass exterior to the vaulted wood interior - a true modern classic. The rooms also did not disappoint - very luxurious and spacious - even if the bathroom only had a shower, but I especially liked the feature where you put your room key into the holder at the door to control the lights - on and off - so that you dont' waste electricity. The pool and hot tub areas were very clean and relaxing, with the changerooms having their own sauna and steam rooms, and lots of personal amenities at hand, made for a comfortable experience. The only draw back was the lack of storage space for clothing while you were swimming or in the steam room - the lockers were keyed for the spa users. The gym facility was top notch, with the latest equipment and open 24 hrs! The restaurant and bar service was good - and the food was great. Overall you couldn't go wrong with a stay in Seattle at the Hyatt @ Olive 8!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: sparkyz
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at this property. The girl that checked me in on the late evening shift on 8/27 was nice as can be. (manager, please tell her that she is doing a great job....as a travel agent, I can't tell you how many hotels I've stayed at and how many of these check-in employees are just "okay". She was outstanding and you should tell her that her great attitude was noticed. It was a great start to an outstanding stay.) As a matter of fact, the entire staff, when encountered in the hotel, was very courteous and polite. Your valet drivers could use a little work when addressing guests but they are nice people. Anyhow, the rooms couldn't be any cleaner. The housekeeping staff did an exceptional job. Every time we re-entered our room after a day on the town, it looked like it did when we first checked in. Also, I can't tell you how much I enjoyed having 8 or 10 or however many of those pillows were on the bed!! Very cool! The bathrooms are very nicely appointed. Honestly, I wasn't a fan of the walk-in shower but I'm sure others like them. Good water pressure, which is clutch. The only negative I have about the entire stay...I called down one night and asked if you guys had meds for indigestion and was told that you didn't have anything like that yet. If you're going to charge $180 a night for a room, you need to step up and have that kind of thing available to your guests. The pool area is awesome and the locker rooms are as clean as every other area of the hotel. Great property. I would recommend it to friends and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location, pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: TuscanVisitor
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful big chain hotel, with a small hotel feel. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful (from the valet to the coffee baristas). The room is very modern and comfortable. They have a wonderful "happy hour" at the restaurant that lasts until midnight - great food, and very accomodating service. The gym was very big with lots of equipment, and a very nice big indoor pool. The location is very convenient - probably 8 blocks to the Pike Market, 2 blocks to the Westlake transit center & monorail - to go to the Space Needle - very fast & inexpensive. You have to try the light rail that leaves from the Westlake center to go to the sports stadiums - only $3.50/round-trip. Ask the concierge to reserve you a spot on the Argossy cruise to get a great tour of the Puget Sound. The only negative about the hotel is the parking price - $33/night, and there's city tax and fees on top of it...total over $39/night! I know it's downtown, but that's a bit steep. Try to check for the AAA rate which was about 20% cheaper than their normal rate. It's a great hotel - check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelerTO
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of six on an 18 night trip to Seattle and British Columbia. The room was exactly as shown on their web-site. It could not have been better for the money. Our only problem was that we were not able to get into the room until 5:00 PM. The location was perfect, and our only complaint was with the breakfast. The hotel does not offer a buffet, and does allow you to go to breakfast quite late. The service was very slow, and the food would rate as OK. I would definitely stay here again. Pay attention to your bill, we had the AAA package which included the breakfasts, and the breakfasts were on the bill at checkout. They removed them without a problem, but check your bill carefully.

Reviews.Title: “8 Days in Seattle and Canada -Hyatt Olive 8 #1”
Reviews.Author: EscapetheHeat09
Reviews.Content: We spent our family vacation in Seatlle (2 nights) and Canada and everyone ranked the Hyatt 8 the best hotel (out of the 5 we stayed). We were amazed at how clean the hotel was and how friendly the staff was to all of us. We had the family package that included the breakfast and loved Urbane's. The food was excellent. Loved the lounge area and happy hour food. Location - not bad -only 7 block walk to the main area of town, but glad to have a short distance away from all of the action. The views are OK from the room (liked the green roof), but fine since we didn't spend much time in th eroom. Only thing was we were placed in a handicap room and didn't realize until that evening and decided too late to change. We would highly recommend to stay here and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise - Nice, new large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Large room and bathroom. Perfect for a family of four. Housekeeping could use a little help. Overall, staff was very helpful and accomodating. I would definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel, with or without kids.”
Reviews.Author: AbenaOhene
Reviews.Content: Went down to Seattle with our kids and another couple just on a short trip from Vancouver for a few days last month. Chose the Hyatt at Olive 8 based on good reviews on TripAdvisor, then booked via Expedia.ca (whose rate we found through the TripAdvisor search engine -- gotta love TripAdvisor!). The Hyatt had no "2 Queen" rooms left at our promo rate ($162 Cdn/night), but we got a King plus rollaway bed, which worked fine for my husband & I and our two 9 year olds. Check in was fast and easy and the front desk, bell and concierge staff were all very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Loved the fact that the hotel is LEEDS-certified (hopefully, more hotels go this route). Well-designed rooms were a nice mix of comfort and modernity and the pool area was lovely (no outside access though). Didn't use the fitness room, but it looked beautiful -- spacious, bright and with great equipment. Great location close to main shopping area, with Pike Place Market/waterfront about a 10-15 minute walk away. The only negative thing about the Olive 8 was crazily expensive overnight parking (I think $30/night or more, which seems to be the norm in downtown Seattle) but we found nearby street & lot parking. Would definitely return to the Olive 8!

Reviews.Title: “Lux, modern, service in brand new hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: gianttrees
Reviews.Content: I have very high expectations for hotel quality and cleanliness and had checked other Tripadvisor ratings before booking. Agree with the positive comments. I found excellent staff, super clean and modern, yet warm and inviting. No problems with water pressure, and never noticed any compromise to quality as result of enviro conscious objective. Booked through Hyatt reservation and used CAA for rate of $179/night - included Breakfast for 2 adults at Urbana restaurant in hotel. Urbana food is top notch gourmet, organic, creative. Breakfast value is $50+ (I think they must have got that wrong) - kindly considerate of kids - organic mac and cheese for kids. Good spa, pool was lap but kids still enjoyed it, great hot tub. Awesome fitness facility! Best I've seen in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, missing a few things”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithbabies
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an excellent one night stay at the Hyatt Olive 8. We have two small children and this is one of the first hotels we have been to that the portable crib was actually waiting set-up in our room (usually I have to do a reminder call)! The rooms are nice and very clean, but not "blow you away" beautiful. Very large bathroom with walk-in shower. There was only one robe which was a bit odd for 2 adults staying in the room. Our biggest issue was with the food options: no mini-bar, would not deliver mixed drinks to the room (only beer and wine)---although you can get a drink from the bar downstairs and carry up, and the bar closed at 12:00 on a Friday night. Basically, no room service or drinks after 12:00 A.M. The wonderful things? Gorgeous lobby, very clean/new, walk to everything downtown, and if you use the AAA rate (coupon code: BREAKF) FREE breakfast in bed (we are talking $85 breakfast for free!!!!). Still can't beat the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “My High expectations were met”
Reviews.Author: portsihamar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Olive 8 with my wife for our anniversary. The hotel was everything I was expecting from a Hyatt - clean rooms and amenities, great service in all areas, great location...everything that really mattered was great. The pool was awesome, Olympic style and great for professional swimmers - I wish I were one to really enjoy that pool. The Jacuzzi was also great, very big. The best thing is that usually there is no one in the pool area - mostly 5 people. I really have nothing negative to say except that I personally didn't like the food at the Urbane restaurant but I am a very picky eater so it doesn't mean the food was bad. Happy hour was great - the food was really cheap. One comment on the bathroom door - I was with my wife so it didn't really matter to me but if I was with anyone else I wouldn't be comfortable using the restroom/shower since the door doesn't lock, it just slides in without attaching with anything. I tried looking inside while the door was all the way shut and you could see the inside so it's really something to look into.... again if you are traveling with your spouse it's not an issue. There is no real great view from this hotel but it's nothing that can be changed. We had a high floor but we only saw buildings, nothing else. Also, I wish since this is a green hotel there was a green area for guests (small grassy area or patio style place). There was really nowhere to hang out in the hotel if you wanted to come out of the room, the lobby is kind of small and has no private places to sit down and relax. Out of 10 I would give this hotel 9 and that's because of the small details above. Would definitely stay there over and over. Thanks again to the Hyatt team working at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: zenmamarunning
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before the RnR Marathon. The room was great! Location just as great. The staff very friendly. I enjoyed that everyone from house keeping, to room service, to front desk always had on smiles. Couldn't help but smile even after my run! Enjoyed the atmosphere and the design. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Hesitate to Stay at This Hyatt - Relaxing environment...”
Reviews.Author: CelticGinger
Reviews.Content: I tagged along on my husband's business conference held at the Hyatt at Olive 8. Our king-sized bed was very plush, in a spacious room. After notifying the staff that we were allergic to feathers, the pillows and duvet were changed promptly. Having the refrigerator in our room helped to keep our bottles of water and fresh fruit cold. The modern bath and shower was well-appointed (did not like the magnifying mirror on the counter though, would rather have the magnifying mirror on the wall). Loved the dimmer switch on the light over the bathroom sink, it worked well as my night-light. I do wish more hotels had this night-light feature. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was delicious, they even had soy milk for my morning coffee! We enjoyed walking to Pike Place Market and other sites from this hotel. My husband enjoyed the pool. Just absolutely loved the robes in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern, clean hotel-- good location for Convention Center or sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MaxandLola
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel, and although I was there for business, I would visit it again if in Seattle for vacation. Modern clean rooms, comfortable bedding, large flat screen TV, and large marble bathroom. The location is great, right in downtown area near convention center and walking distance to the Public Market and tourist areas. The lobby had a coffee bar during day-- switching to a wine bar at night--great espresso. Also, the restaurant attached to the hotel (Urbane) was surprisingly good. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. A few unusual things that make it a "green" hotel that not everyone may appreciate, but I did. One is the need to put your key card in a holder near the light switch to turn the power on in the room. Another is that they will not change towels every day--although you can call housekeeping to have them changed more frequently. I was there for four nights and the linens and towels were changed once--without me calling. Modern electronic connections including an ipod system- a planted green roof--recycling bins in the rooms-- made for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hammon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our 10 year anniversary in Seattle and the Olive 8 not only met but exceeded our expectations. It is a beautiful new hotel in a great location. The staff went out of their way to make our weekend memorable. We really enjoyed breakfast at the hotel’s restaurant. We actually ate there the first morning, and then tried another location on Saturday but it wasn’t even comparable. Needless to say, we were back at Urbane for our final fantastic, organic breakfast. Not only was the food good, but the hotel also had nice fitness center and pool. My wife also really enjoyed the spa. I have nothing negative at all to say about this hotel or its staff. I would like to thank the Olive 8’s staff for all of your special attention and efforts in making our anniversary wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Location, Room, Service and Style!”
Reviews.Author: micnmissy
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel conveniently located in the heart of downtown. It's an easy walk to several of the attractions in the downtown area of the city. The hotel staff is friendly, accommodating, and professional. Our room was beautiful with a comfortable bed, flat screen tv's, and a spacious bathroom. The style of the hotel is modern and comfortable. The workout facility and pool are second to none. Additionally, we really liked the fact that it was a LEED certified hotel, apparently the first of it's kind in Seattle. That just goes to show that a lot of time and effort was put into making the hotel "green" and you can tell that the detail continues on in the staff and accommodations. We didn't eat in the restaurant, however we did participate in the Happy Hour and really enjoyed the food and of course the drinks. In the end, this is a great hotel for an affordable price with pretty much everything you need for a comfortable stay for business or pleasure. Two enthusiastic thumbs up from me and my wife!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: labblues
Reviews.Content: The room is nice. The bed was comfy. Not too crazy about the shower without a door / curtain. I kept thinking that the water will get all over the bathroom floor. Didn't happen, but just uncomfortable feeling for me. I like my enclosed tub when I shower! The maid forgot to restock the bathroom once, but was quickly remedied after I called the front desk. Brand new fitness center. They are really proud of their LEED status! Not a big deal for me. Valet parking was pricy, but normal in downtown Seattle area. The attendants were really prompt with the car; it was always ready by the time we got to the car port. The restaurant downstairs was okay. The food was not too great and the service was so-so. Overall, nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdoctor49
Reviews.Content: Even though I read a review that was only somewhat favorable prior to booking the reservation, I wanted to decide for myself. The hotel was fabulous and yet affordable. Great, accomodating staff. The room had just enough special touches and amenities that it was obviously a Hyatt offspring. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean rooms and good value.”
Reviews.Author: David1988
Reviews.Content: This new hotel in the heart of Seattle was a surprise. It is around the corner from Pacific Place and Nordsrtom's, See's Candies, and the monorail. Within walking distance from the Pike Place Market, without being too close for comfort. I was givin an upgrade to a large luxury suite. The tub in the bath was huge! The staff of the hotel were very nice. There is a coffee bar in the lobby and the whole hotel is very "European". Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marce_LCh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful and is located in a perfect zone to walk and go shopping. Really nice bed and very big bath.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, simplicity and contemporary!”
Reviews.Author: hotelbug68
Reviews.Content: It was not fully working, but it is a hotel with beautiful, contemporary and design, staffs are friendly and helpful. Hotel restaurant (not like the other hotel restaurant)- must try, fresh local ingredients, reasonable prices!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: CATLOVER__CB
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I loved this brand new hotel! Walking distance to the Market, stores and resturants. The employees are friendly and very helpful. Rooms are a good size for 2 people and very comfortable. We had breakfast in their resturant , and it was pretty good. Again, great wait staff. For anyone that likes to get a good workout in while vacationing.....the 2nd floor gym is for you! All brand new equipment. Weights, cables, ellipticals, treadmills, bikes and stability balls....and more. Love it!!! We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Cleared out All My Bank Accounts!”
Reviews.Author: folkystar
Reviews.Content: As a few reviewers have already stated, this is a new hotel, equipped with everything that comes with it: fancy enviro-friendly features that mostly don't work, and a staff that trips over every situation. Beyond the fact that we chose this hotel for the pool and spa and upon arrival were told they were out of service, Hyatt robbed me and my wife of more than $2,000 during our three night stay, making our vacation utterly useless... After negotiating a refund for our final night's stay due to the lack of amenities described on their website, we patiently awaited the credit to our account (in addition to a $400 credit we were supposed to receive from gift certificates we presented at the front desk). None of these credits showed up, and the next morning, we were charged three times the full amount of our three night stay! Although Hyatt had deposited our gift certificates, they never bothered to give us the credit! Management apologized (not adequately, FYI) but gave no clear explanation of why this happened. After speaking to my bank, the manager (name of JP) promptly left for four days to go on vacation, leaving us with his trusty Assistant, Claudia. Claudia continuously apologized, but was unable to change the fact that all three of our bank accounts were down to ZERO (one of them was in the red), because of their "mistake" (I am being generous calling it a mistake, as since then several things have happened to lead me to believe this might have been malicious). Claudia then told us to have drinks on the house. We asked if two friends could join us and she agreed. Our last night we spent drinking with a couple friends, trying to enjoy ourselves since we had been stuck in the hotel for three days with NO MONEY. The next morning Claudia informed us that our charges were unjust and she didn't think they should have to pay for it (total for four of us was $200 + tip - average drink cost at their pricey bar was $16! - that averages two drinks per person). Unjust? I think not! After arguing with her, she agreed to cover it. I told her I wanted a receipt and she informed me that I did not need one. Of course, when we returned home I found that they had indeed charged my debit card for the full amount, even before they had fully refunded our $2,000!!!! I am still awaiting a resolution for this problem. Hotel management has now decided to tell me that they are standing by the charges - basically admitting that Claudia lied to us, but being perfectly okay with that. They have the upper hand, because we gave them our credit card number - apparently if you have someone's credit card number you can charge them to the end of the Earth! Being a new hotel might excuse the pool and spa being closed, it might excuse the faulty wi-fi and the bunk air conditioning, but it does not excuse petty theft!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March. Check-in was efficient. The employees were all very helpful. What really impressed me about this hotel was the interior design. It really is well done. The rooms are a bit small. The beds very comfortable and the bathrooms were small as well, but I suspect this has to do with its eco-friendly nature. The breakfast menu was varied and the food very good. They avoid bottled water by serving purified city water and I have always wondered why more restaurants don't do that. It was a nice touch. We purchased the Awaken Package which included breakfast. they told me it would be deducted at check-out. I am always leery of that but indeed it did not appear on the bill. The workout and pool area were one of the best I have seen in a downtown hotel . The equipment is first rate and the area very clean and well maintained. The hotel is well situated in the center of town and easy to find. They have chilled towels which is an added bonus. There is a bit of hall noise that makes its way into the rooms. I always anticipate this and bring a fan for white noise. Curiously, when I was leaving the hotel, the concierge told me I didn't need to bring that as they have fans if the guest requests one. That showed me the kind of effort and forethought they put into their guests. I would definitely stay here again. I am a big fan of the Grand Hyatt and it will be tough to choose between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RJRVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have been to every hotel imaginable in North America! From your 30 dollars a night to your 800 dollars per night! This hotel definately fit all my tastes! If you're going for modern esthetics, this is your hotel! the service is amazing as well. The bathrooms are a generous size! Definately gives you room to move around! This hotel has everything you would need as a business traveller. The desks are great with plugs for ALL your electronics (USB, digi video, 4 power outlets, pc video, etc). I ate nearly all of my meals at the hotel restaurant, "Urbane". The staff there were GREAT. Most of them remembered my name and they were always friendly. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel! Nice fresh furnishings and a great modern young design! The only thing i'd change about my stay, if i could have, would have been the view. Although, it's in the middle of seattle There isn't much you can do besides knock down a few other buildings!

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, great food at Urbane and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: GleanGuy
Reviews.Content: I went on a 3 day business trip and thought I'd give the whole LEEDS hotel thing a try. Wasn't disappointed. The lobby entire hotel feels open and very clean. The rooms were very efficient in their layout with HD channels and a big LG flat screen tv. The bathroom had a large sliding door and they used some beautiful tile and granite to finish it. They also had an interesting energy saving feature that you used your room key to keep the lights on. Which not only work well, it kept the key in one spot which saved those embarrassing trips to the front desk after locking yourself out. They also included toothpaste, which seems small but I had forgot mine and that saved me wandering around to buy some more. It was also nice to see a hotel with a social conscience. The roof is the largest green roof in Seattle where they'll be growing herbs and spices for the restaurant (I got a full rundown from the bartender). The shower head conserves water but doesn't feel any different that a normal shower. They won't change the towels until you let them know. The toilets are #1 and #2 flush. They even have a water purifying system in the restaurant that nearly eliminates their need for plastic bottles of water. The kitchen apparently has an extensive organic compost program too, although I was on my third Mojito (incredible, freshest tasting drink, must try) so I didn't catch all the details. All very impressive. Oh and the fitness center was equipped with gear that would make some modern gyms jealous. If you're a fitness buff this alone is a huge feature. Location was great. I did manage to walk down to Pike Place Market in about 15 minutes. Otherwise it was all business and meetings. The only shortcoming I found was there was a bit of work being done on the lobby floor when I arrived but they seemed to be done when I checked out. I would definitely stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke & Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: PHXJeremy
Reviews.Content: Overall, this property holds a lot of promise, but Hyatt jumped the gun a bit on opening when they did. The staff was tripping overthemselves to figure things out that were pretty basic. For example - as a platinum member, I asked for a room on a high floor - got a low floor, looking directly into the hotel across the street. Goofy stuff like that makes a stay uncomfortable. I was part of a group at the hotel and 2 of our folks got food poisoning from a veggie dish. Water pressure in the rooms was odd and not reliable. Things that are good - the pool was amazing, as was the gym. Parking seemed to move quickly. Location was good. Quiet part of downtown, but not out of the way. Overall - if you get a good deal, go for it. Just bring some patience for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff except for one person who ruined my stay”
Reviews.Author: JLK9
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel--a bit stark, especially compared to The Paramount next door. Staff was extremely friendly except for one person who left me with a very bad taste: I had asked the bellhop if they had a business center where I could check my e-mails. The business center wasn't up and running yet. Because there were no other guests around, he said I could use one of the front desk computers. He led me around to the computer and a front desk clerk entered my home page. I had just started to read an e-mail, when another staff person appeared at my elbow and asked in a loud, rude voice, "Who told you you could use this computer?" I was stunned, but I meekly turned to the other two staff and said, "These guys." She then proceeded to berate me and demand that I leave the computer, which of course, I did. I was shocked and needless to say, that negative feeling is what I'm left with. There are too many other nice hotels in downtown Seattle for me to want to go here again. Beyond that, the sound-proofing between rooms was terrible. We had to listen to a roomful of women next door laughing and carrying on. Very unpleasant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt At Olive 8
HotelInfo.Address: 1635 8th Avenue, Seattle, WA 98101
